# Invitation to Bid for Janitorial & Cleaning Services

## General Information
- **Bid Number:** AMCE-02/25
- **Company:** The Automotive Manufacturing Company of Ethiopia Share Company (AMCE)

## Bid Documents and Fees
- Interested bidders may obtain the bid documents from the Purchasing Logistics Department upon payment of a non-refundable fee of Birr 300.00.
- Documents will be available until the closing date for bids, which is Monday to Friday starting from April 7, 2025.

## Eligibility Requirements
Bidders must include the following documents with their proposal:
- Valid Trade License
- Tax Clearance Certificate
- VAT Registration Certificate
- TIN Certificate
- Any other necessary documents as specified in the Terms of Reference (TOR)

## Submission of Bids
- **Technical and Financial Offers:** Both must be sealed separately and labeled "Bid for Janitorial and Cleaning Services."
- **Deadline:** Proposals should be submitted to the Purchasing & Logistics Department at AMCE by April 24, 2025, at 10:00 A.M.

## Bid Security
- A bid security of Birr 50,000.00 is required in the form of a Cashier's Payment Order (CPO) only.
- The bid opening will take place on April 24, 2025, at 10:30 A.M., in AMCE's Meeting Room.

## Site Visits
- Bidders are encouraged to visit the site from Monday to Friday during the following hours:
  - Morning: 8:30 A.M. to 12:30 P.M.
  - Afternoon: 1:30 P.M. to 5:30 P.M.

## Rights Reserved
- AMCE reserves the right to accept or reject any or all bids at its discretion.

## Inquiries
For further inquiries, please contact:
- **Manager of Purchasing Logistics Department**
- **Company:** The Automotive Manufacturing Company of Ethiopia Share Company (AMCE Sh. Co.)
- **Address:** P.O. Box 5736, Addis Ababa, Ethiopia
- **Phone:** Tel. No. 011 646 3311/46
- **Email:** eskinder.wsenbet@ivecogroup.com

  - Each episode will have 20 minutes of airtime.
  - Frequency: Twice a week for 14 Episodes.

- **High Energy Biscuit**

  - Quantity: 230 packs
  - Majority is fasting.

- **Leaflet Printing**

  - Quantity: 21,000

- **Vehicle Rent**
  - Double cabin pickup (model KUN25L)
    - Engine capacity: cc and above
    - Number of engine cylinders: 4
    - Year of manufacturing: 2018 and above
    - Fuel type: Diesel
    - Capacity: 4 seats
    - Single fuel tanker
    - Good condition
    - Complete accessories (two spare tires, spanner, wheel wrench, hydraulic jack, fire extinguisher, shovel, etc.)
  - Quantity: 4

- **T-shirt Price Including Printing Cost**
  - 180gm O shape cotton T-shirt with four logos, picture with text.
  - Quantity: 660
  - Bidders can take the printing design from RaDO Office.

- **Stickers Printing**
  - Print on 40cm x 60cm metal sheet with colored texts, pictures, and logos as per the design from RaDO.
  - Quantity: 800
  - Bidders can take the printing design from RaDO Office.

- **Metal Sheet**
  - Metal sheet of size 40cm x 60cm with a thickness of 1.5mm to be fixed on walls or with drilling and screw.
  - Quantity: 800

- **Medal**
  - Golden small size, costumed ribbon with logos and text and graphics (baj rope print with text picture and logos).
  - Quantity: 560

- **Safe Steps Matt with Text and Picture Print**
  - 3mx2m matt with text and picture print.
  - Quantity: 50
  - Bidders can take the printing design from RaDO Office.

## Eligibility Requirements

- Have legal capacity to enter into a procurement contract by submitting proper trade license.
- Have fulfilled any legal obligation to pay tax through a tax clearance certificate.
- Renewed Business License for 2017 E.

generated.clean_description:
# Expressions of Interest for Agrarian Analysis Study (AAS) in Maze National Park

## Project Overview
- **Project Name:** The Preservation of Maze National Park and its Watershed in Ethiopia
- **Funding Source:** Agence Française de Développement (AFD)
- **Implementing Organization:** Hailemariam & Roman Foundation (HRF)

## Project Context
- **Park Location:** Maze National Park, South Ethiopia
- **Project Duration:** 2024-2028
- **Overall Goal:** Ensure the long-term integrity of Maze National Park for the benefit of nature and communities.
- **Supporting Frameworks:**
  - Environmental and Social Management Framework (ESMF)
  - Environmental and Social Management Plan (ESMP)

## Objectives of the Agrarian Analysis Study (AAS)
- Assess current livelihood strategies and activities of local communities surrounding the park.
- Evaluate their impact on biodiversity.
- Suggest alternative, sustainable livelihood options that balance community economic needs with conservation goals.

### Specific Tasks
1. **Socio-Economic and Demographic Profiles:**
   - Collect data from five woredas (Zala, Daramalo, Kucha, Kucha Alpha, and Kamba).
2. **Documentation of Agricultural and Off-Farm Activities:**
   - Document existing agricultural and off-farm activities.
3. **Recommendation for Sustainable Livelihood Strategies:**
   - Recommend strategies to reduce pressure on the park's resources.

## Scope of Services
- **Data Collection Tools Design:** Develop tools for data collection.
- **Surveys, Key Informant Interviews, Focus Group Discussions, and Field Observations:** Conduct these activities within 17 park-adjacent kebeles.
- **Report Development:** Prepare a comprehensive report based on findings, including recommendations for sustainable livelihoods and strategies to mitigate the impact of agricultural activities.

## Expected Deliverables
- Inception Report
- Draft AAS Report
- Final AAS Report with a brief policy brief
- Clean datasets for future monitoring and evaluation

## Duration and Reporting
- **Duration:** Approximately 2-3 months.
- **Stakeholder Engagement:** Collaborate with local government offices, park staff, and the HRF Program team to validate findings.

## Requirements
- **Expertise:** Multiple expert months required.
- **Responsibilities:** Fieldwork, data analysis, report preparation.

## Important Dates and Amounts
- **Start Date:** To be determined upon contract signing.
- **Contract Size:** Multiple expert months (amount not specified in the original document).

---

original.title: The United Nations Economic Commission for Africa (UNECA) in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, hereby seeks expressions of interest (EOI) from qualified and experienced vendors for the Procurement of Emergency Medicines for Pharmaceutical Items LTA

requirements: Must be legally registered and licensed to operate as a pharmaceutical wholesaler, or community pharmacy.
Must possess all necessary licenses, permits, and registrations required by the relevant national drug regulatory authority.
Must ensure that all supplied medicines & Medical supplies are legally imported or manufactured, with all required documentation (e.g., import licenses, certificates of origin)

The vendor must maintain high standards of quality control and assurance throughout their supply chain. Medicines must meet all relevant quality standards and specifications set by the local regulatory authority.
Must have a proven track record of supplying high-quality, authentic, and safe medications. Capacity and Reliability:
The vendor must demonstrate the capacity to consistently supply the required medicines in the quantities and timeframe specified by the UNHCC.
Must demonstrate a reliable and consistent supply chain to ensure uninterrupted availability of medications.
Must maintain adequate stock levels to meet the UNHCC's anticipated demand.
The vendor should provide information on their stock levels and supply chain capabilities.
Companies can only participate in solicitations of the UN Secretariat after completing their registration (free of charge) at the United Nations Global Marketplace (www.ungm.org).

As you express interest in the planned solicitation by submitting this response form, please verify that your company is registered under its full legal name on the United Nations Global Marketplace(www.ungm.org) and that your application has been submitted to the UN Secretariat.

While companies can participate in solicitations after completion of registration at Basic Level, we strongly recommend all companies to register at least at Level 1 under the United Nations Secretariat prior to participating in any solicitations.

Companies are reminded of the restrictions of employment of former UN personnel that were involved in the procurement process during their last three years of service as per ST/SGB/2006/15, including (a) employing those personnel for one year after separation of service and (b) allowing those personnel to communicate with, or appear before, active UN personnel for matters related to the procurement process for two years after separation of service. Violation of the provisions of ST/SGB/2006/15 may lead to suspension of the registration of the company as a UN vendor.

specifications.Note: Information on tendering for the UN Procurement System is available free of charge at the following address:https://www.ungm.org/Public/NoticeOnly the United Nations Global Marketplace (UNGM) has been authorised to collect a nominal fee from vendors that wish to receive automatically Procurement Notices or Requests for Expression Of Interest. Vendors interested in this Tender Alert Service are invited to subscribe onhttp://www.ungm.org

generated.clean_description:
# United Nations Economic Commission for Africa (UNECA) Expression of Interest (EOI)

## General Information

- **Title of EOI:** Procurement of Emergency Medicines for Pharmaceutical Items LTA
- **Date of this EOI:** 10 April 2025
- **Closing Date for Receipt of EOI:** 25 April 2025
- **EOI Number:** EOIUNECA23570
- **Beneficiary Country/Territory:** Ethiopia
- **Commodity/Service Category:** Health Services

## Contact Information

- **Attention Of:** Ms. Etsegenet Teka / Mr. Ali Assaad / Ms. Aster Zewde
- **E-mail Address:** etsegenet.argaw@un.org
- **Fax Number:** N/A

## Description of Requirements

The United Nations Economic Commission for Africa (UNECA) in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, seeks expressions of interest from qualified and experienced vendors for the procurement of emergency medicines for pharmaceutical items LTA.

### Objectives

- To minimize stockouts and ensure the steady availability of essential medicines.
- To enhance the responsiveness of the pharmacy unit to the needs of healthcare providers.
- To improve overall healthcare delivery and patient satisfaction among staff.

### Procurement Scope

The United Nations Healthcare Center (UNHCC) aims to procure unavailable essential emergency medicines from pharmaceutical wholesalers and community pharmacies. The initiative includes:

- Preventing stockouts
- Ensuring continuous provision of high-quality healthcare services to UNHCC beneficiaries

## Legal and Regulatory Compliance

- **Registration:** Must be legally registered and licensed to operate as a pharmaceutical wholesaler or community pharmacy.
- **Licenses and Permits:** Must possess all necessary licenses, permits, and registrations required by the relevant national drug regulatory authority.
- **Documentation:** Ensure that all supplied medicines and medical supplies are legally imported or manufactured, with all required documentation (e.g., import licenses, certificates of origin) provided upon request.

## Quality Assurance

- **Quality Control Standards:** Maintain high standards of quality control and assurance throughout the supply chain. Medicines must meet all relevant quality standards and specifications set by the local regulatory authority.
- **Track Record:** Must have a proven track record of supplying high-quality, authentic, and safe medications.

## Capacity and Reliability

- **Supply Chain Capabilities:** Demonstrate the capacity to consistently supply the required medicines in the quantities and timeframe specified by the UNHCC.
- **Reliable Supply:** Ensure a reliable and consistent supply chain to guarantee uninterrupted availability of medications.
- **Stock Levels:** Maintain adequate stock levels to meet the UNHCC's anticipated demand. Provide information on current stock levels and supply chain capabilities.

## Submission Instructions

All queries regarding this EOI should be directed to United Nations Economic Commission for Africa using the provided e-mail address or fax number (if available).

For further details, please contact:
- **E-mail Address:** etsegenet.argaw@un.org

generated.clean_description:
# Call for Expression of Interest: Consultancy Service on Gender Analysis

## Background
- **Organization**: Ipas-Ethiopia, a non-governmental international organization established in 2000.
- **Mission**: Collaborates with government and non-government actors to build resilient sexual and reproductive health and rights (SRHR) focusing on abortion and contraceptive ecosystems using a comprehensive approach across sectors, institutions, and communities.
- **Purpose of Gender Analysis**: To recognize the strong correlation between gender inequality and SRHR, Ipas-Ethiopia plans to conduct a Gender Analysis to become gender responsive and subsequently gender transformative by the end of the project period.

## Context
- **Regions**: Amhara, Benishangul Gumuz, Central Ethiopia, Oromia, and Tigray.
- **Settings**:
  - Community setting
  - Health system settings

## Deliverables
- Inception report containing methods and approaches for GA
- A set of raw data, audio records, and transcriptions
- The first draft of the GA report
- Second draft GA report
- Final GA report with recommendations (2 hard copies and soft copies)
- Presentation on key findings and recommendations to Ipas management and staff

## Qualification and Requirements
- **Principal Investigator/Lead Consultant**:
  - Minimum postgraduate degree in health or relevant social sciences fields of study, such as public health, social work, sociology, demography, gender, health informatics, monitoring and evaluation, knowledge management, or social and behavioral change communications.
- **Consultancy Firm**:
  - Legally registered with a taxpayers identification number (TIN) and a renewed license valid until 2025 (2017 E.C.).
  - At least five years of proven experience in facilitating and conducting Gender Analysis, particularly in the SRH field with Non-Governmental Organizations.
- **Availability**: The consulting firm should include only those experts and professionals who will be available during the consultancy assignment.

## Collection & Submission of Bid Document
1. **Technical Proposal**:
   - Firm's legal documents: trade license, professional license, TIN number, profile, recommendations, testimonies, similar sample tasks accomplished.
2. **Financial Proposal**: 
3. **Submission Method and Deadline**:
   - Technical and financial proposals should be submitted separately in sealed and waxed envelopes.
   - Electronic copies of the technical and financial proposals must also be submitted within 10 days from the date of announcement.

## Note
- Interested and eligible bidders can collect the full bidding document from Ipas Ethiopia's country office located at Micky Leland Street (Behind Caravan Hotel).
- Contact Information: Tel: +251 11 663 3379/011 662 6311, Email: zewdieh@ipas.org, P. O. Box 63001 Addis Ababa, Ethiopia.
- Only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.

## Additional Information
- Female applicants are highly encouraged!

---

#### 3. Bidding Process
Bidding will be conducted through national competitive procurement using a Request for Bids (RFB) as specified in the World Bank's "Procurement Regulations for IPF Borrowers" dated September 2023, and is open to all eligible Bidders as defined in the Procurement Regulations.

#### 7. Bid Security
All Bids must be accompanied by a Bid Security of ETB 1,000 (One Thousand birr) in the form of an unconditional Bank guarantee or CPO.

#### 8. Beneficial Ownership Disclosure

original.title: The Ministry of Water and Energy now invites sealed bids from eligible bidders for the Construction, Operation, and Maintenance of the Fecal Sludge and Septage Treatment Plant for Bahir Dar Town, 552km north-western of Addis Ababa

requirements: Employer: Ministry of Water and Energy
Project: Ethiopia Second Urban Water Supply and Sanitation Project
Contract Title: Construction, Operation, and Maintenance of Fecal Sludge and Septage
Treatment Plant for Bahir Dar Town
Credit No.: IDA-60070/60080
Reference No. ET-MOWIE-466032-CW-RFB
Issued on: 14 April 2025

The Government of The Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia has received financing from the World Bank toward the cost of the Second Urban Water Supply and Sanitation Project and intends to apply part of the proceeds toward payments under the contract for the Construction, Operation, and Maintenance of Fecal Sludge and Septage Treatment Plant for Bahir Dar Town

The Ministry of Water and Energy now invites sealed bids from eligible bidders for the Construction, Operation, and Maintenance of the Fecal Sludge and Septage Treatment Plant for Bahir Dar Town, 552km north-western of Addis Ababa. The construction and operation period is 18 months. The work consists of Preliminary and General Items, Receiving Chamber/ Screen unit, Construction of Settling Tank, Sludge drying bed, Transfer Station, Anaerobic Ponds, Constructed Wetland feeding station, Constructed Wetland, Chlorination Unit, Service Building, Sludge Storage Area, Road Works, Water Supply for FSTP, Testing, Commissioning, Operation & Maintenance, and Electro Mechanical Works, Margin of preference applicable

Bidding will be conducted through the International Competitive Biddingprocedures as specified in the World Bank's Guidelines: Procurement of Goods, Works and Non-Consulting Services under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits & Grants by World Bank Borrowers January 2011 ("Procurement Guidelines"), and is open to all eligible bidders as defined in the Procurement Guidelines. In addition, please refer to paragraphs 1.6 and 1.7 setting forth the World Bank's policy on conflict of interest. Bidders shall fulfill the following qualification requirements: (i) Financial capability: The Bidder shall demonstrate that it has access to, or has available, liquid assets, unencumbered real assets, lines of credit, and other financial means (independent of any contractual advance payment) sufficient to meet the construction cash flow requirements estimated as ETB 400,000,000 (ETB Four Hundred Million) or US$ 3,300,000 (US$ three Million three hundred thousand) for the subject contract (s) net of the Bidders other commitments. (ii) Minimum average annual construction turnover of ETB 2,500,000,000(ETB Two Billion and five Hundred Million) or US$ 20,000,000 (US$ twenty Million), calculated as total certified payments received for and/or completed within the last 5(Five) contracts in progress years, divided by 5(Five)years, starting 1st January 2020. (iii) Specific Experience: A minimum number of similar contracts specified below that have been satisfactorily and substantially completed as a prime contractor, joint venture member, management contractor or sub-contractor8 between 1st January 2020 and application submission deadline: (i) One ( I) contract with a minimum value of ETB 1,800,000,000 (ETB one Billion Eight Hundred Million) or USD 15,000,000 (US$ fifteen Million) OR - (ii) two (2) contracts each with minimum value of ETB 950,000,000 (ETB Nine Hundred fifty Million) or USD 7,500,000 (US$ Seven Million five Hundred Thousand) and (iv) for the above and any other contracts completed and under implementation as prime contractor, joint venture member, management contractor or sub-contractor on or after the first day of the calendar year during the period stipulated in 4.2 (a) above, a minimum construction experience in the following key activities successfully completed: Construction of Wastewater Treatment plant/ Fecal Sludge Treatment plant/Water Supply Treatment Plant with the minimum treatment capacity of 1000 m3/day/ experience in construction of water supply schemes at least to the size of 10,000m3/day.

Bidding will be conducted through the International Competitive Bidding procedures as specified in the World Bank's Guidelines: Procurement of Goods, Works and Non- Consulting Services under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits & Grants by World Bank Borrowers January 2011 ("Procurement Guidelines"), and is open to all eligible bidders as defined in the Procurement Guidelines. In addition, please refer to paragraphs 1.6 and 1.7 setting forth the World Bank's policy on conflict of interest.

Interested eligible bidders may obtain further information from the Ministry of Water and Energy (MoWE), Mr. Nuredin Mohammed, email:nuredinmohammed@yahoo.comand or Mrs. Tsige Meried, email:13mtsige@gmail.comand inspect the bidding documents during office hours from 8:30 am -12:30 pm in the morning and 1:30 pm to 5:00 pm in the afternoon at the address given below.

The bidding documents in English language will be available and can be downloaded from the Ministry of Water and Energy (MOWE) web page using the following link free of cost:https://www.mowe.gov.et/en/tender. In addition, the bidders can also obtain the soft copy of the bidding document through email by sending their request to the above email address. Bidders are required to register in person at the following address or notify the Ministry using the email addresses given above that they have downloaded the document and they will submit their bid. Bids must be deliveredto the address below on or before 29 May 2025, 10:00 pm.Electronic bidding will not be permitted. Late bids will be rejected. Bids will be publicly opened in the presence of the bidders' designated representatives and anyone who chooses to attend at the address on29 May 2025, 10:30 pm or (immediately after the bids submission deadline).
All bids must be accompanied by aBid Security of ETB 20,000,000(ETB Twenty million only) or US$ 160,000 (USD One Hundred Sixty Thousand)
All Bids must be accompanied by a Sexual Exploitation and Abuse (SEA) and/or Sexual Harassment (SH) Declaration.
The address (es) referred to above is (are):

# Request for Bids

## Employer
- Ministry of Water and Energy

## Project
- Ethiopia Second Urban Water Supply and Sanitation Project

## Contract Title
- Construction, Operation, and Maintenance of Fecal Sludge and Septage Treatment Plant for Bahir Dar Town

## Country
- Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia

## Credit No.
- IDA-60070/60080

## Reference No.
- ET-MOWIE-466032-CW-RFB

## Issued on
- 14 April 2025

### Project Description
The Government of The Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia has received financing from the World Bank toward the cost of the Second Urban Water Supply and Sanitation Project. Part of these proceeds will be applied to payments under the contract for the Construction, Operation, and Maintenance of a Fecal Sludge and Septage Treatment Plant in Bahir Dar Town, which is located 552km north-western of Addis Ababa.

### Bidding Process
- **Bidding Method:** International Competitive Bidding
- **Guidelines:** World Bank's Guidelines: Procurement of Goods, Works and Non-Consulting Services under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits & Grants by World Bank Borrowers January 2011 ("Procurement Guidelines")
- **Eligibility:** Open to all eligible bidders as defined in the Procurement Guidelines
- **Conflict of Interest Policy:** Refer to paragraphs 1.6 and 1.7 for details

### Qualification Requirements
- **Financial Capability:**
  - The Bidder must demonstrate access to, or availability of, liquid assets, unencumbered real assets, lines of credit, and other financial means (independent of any contractual advance payment) sufficient to meet the construction cash flow requirements estimated as ETB 400,000,000 (ETB Four Hundred Million) or US$ 3,300,000 (US$ three Million three hundred thousand) for the subject contract(s), net of the Bidder's other commitments.
- **Minimum Average Annual Construction Turnover:**
  - ETB 2,500,000,000 (ETB Two Billion and five Hundred Million) or US$ 20,000,000 (US$ twenty Million), calculated as total certified payments received for and/or completed within the last 5 years, starting from 1st January 2020.

### Work Scope
- Preliminary and General Items
- Receiving Chamber/Screen Unit
- Construction of Settling Tank
- Sludge Drying Bed
- Transfer Station
- Anaerobic Ponds
- Constructed Wetland Feeding Station
- Constructed Wetland
- Chlorination Unit
- Service Building
- Sludge Storage Area
- Road Works
- Water Supply for FSTP (Fecal Sludge Treatment Plant)
- Testing, Commissioning, Operation & Maintenance
- Electro Mechanical Works

### Construction and Operation Period
- 18 months

generated.clean_description:
### Invitation for Bid (IFB)
**Project Reference:** ET-MOWE-460631-GO-RFB  
**Ministry of Water and Energy**  
**Country:** The Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia

#### Project Name:
Climate Resilient - Water Supply and Sanitation Project

#### Contract Title:
Procurement of (Lot-1) #2 Geophysical Instruments and (Lot-2) Surveying Instruments for the CWA-II PMU Geologist & Surveyor staffs

**Loan/Credit No.:**
IDA 64450

---

### Description of Goods
- **Goods:** Procurement of (Lot-1) #2 Geophysical Instrument and (Lot-2) Surveying Instruments for the CWA-II PMU Geologist & Surveyor staffs.
- **Units:**
  - Lot-1: 2 Geophysical Instruments
  - Lot-2: Surveying Instruments
- **Quantity:** As specified in the bid
- **Delivery Period:**
  - Lot-1: 60 days
  - Lot-2: 90 days
- **Final Destination:** Warehouse of the Ministry

---

### Qualification Requirements:
In addition to the requirements listed below, bidders are encouraged to read and respond to the exhaustive list of post-qualification requirements specified in section III of the RFB.

1. **Financial Capability:**
   - The Bidder shall submit audited financial statements or, if not required by the law of the Bidder's country, other financial statements acceptable to the Purchaser, for the last five years (2020-2024) prior to bid submission deadline, demonstrating the current soundness of the Bidder's financial position.
   - For a joint venture, this requirement shall be met by each member.

2. **Specific Experience:**
   - The Bidder shall demonstrate that it has successfully completed at least one contract within the last five years prior to bid submission deadline, each with a value of at least 6,000,000.00 ETB for Lot-1 and 6,000,000.00 ETB for Lot-2 that have been successfully and substantially completed and are similar in nature and complexity to the Goods and Related Services under the Contract (Supply of Geophysical or surveying instrument).

---

### Bidding Process
The bidding will be conducted through national competitive procurement using a Request for Bids (RFB) as specified in the World Bank's "Procurement Regulations for IPF Borrowers" (July, 2016, revised November, 2017, July 2018 and November 2020, September 2023), ("Procurement Regulations"), which can be found at [worldbank.org](https://www.worldbank.org). This process incorporates the national procurement directives as required to make it consistent with World Bank requirements. The bid is open to all eligible Bidders as defined in the Procurement Regulations.

---

### Contact Information
For further information, interested eligible bidders may contact:
- **Mr. Tesfaye Lulie**, PMU Coordinator  
  - Email: tesfayelulie.ownp@gmail.com

A scanned copy of the bidding document, prepared in English, is available for free download at [https://www.mowe.gov](https://www.mowe.gov).

generated.clean_description:
# Tender Notice for Commodity Freight Transport Service

## Reference Number and Office Information
- **Reference Number:** PR Serial Number-17590/91/98/99
- **Office:** FH Ethiopia

## Tender Document Collection and Submission Details
- **Collection Date and Time:** 15 April 2025 to 29 April 2025, from 8:30 AM to 5:00 PM
- **Closing Date and Time for Receipt of Tenders:** 30 April 2025 at 4:00 PM
- **Tender Opening Date and Time:** 1 May 2025 at 3:00 PM, @ FHE-Addis Ababa

## Overview of FH Ethiopia
FH Ethiopia (FHE) is an International Non-governmental Organization engaged in relief and development activities. It has been implementing development and humanitarian activities in Ethiopia for the past 37 years.

## Tender Invitation
FH Ethiopia invites interested freight transportation service providers to participate in an open bid process to transport food commodities from Kombolcha, Nefasmewcha, and Mekelle to different final distribution points (FDPs) of Amhara and Tigray region woredas for a period of one year (with possible extension) on Framework Agreement basis.

## Eligibility Criteria
- **Trade Licenses:** Renewed and relevant
- **Tax Identification Number**
- **Value Added Tax Certificates**
- **Valid Registration Certificate from the Road Transport Authority (Dry Freight Transport certificate)**
- **Minimum 5 owned trucks in the name of bidder trade name, installed with GPS**
- **Bid Security Bond in the form of CPO (200,000 ETB) in the name of FH Ethiopia**
- **Vehicle Insurance Certificate**

## Tender Document Collection
Interested and eligible bidders can obtain a complete set of bidding documents from FH Ethiopia Addis Ababa Office between 8:30 AM to 5:00 PM on weekdays (Monday to Friday).

## Submission Details
- **Bio DOCUMENT:** Produced in separate envelopes marked as ORIGINAL and COPY, then sealed, stamped, and submitted to FH ETHIOPIA HEAD OFFICE by the deadline of 30 April 2025 at 4:00 PM.
- **Address for Submission:** FH Ethiopia, Megenagna Area around 40/60 Condominium, In front Of Ministry Of Revenue, Adjacent to Kideste Mariom Primary School, P. O. Box 4181, Addis Ababa, Ethiopia.

## Award Criteria
Tenders will be awarded marks under the following criteria:
- **Price:** 60%
- **Technical:** 40%

## Essential Criteria
- Renewed and relevant Trade licenses.
- Tax Identification Number.
- Value Added Tax Certificates.
- Valid registration certificate from the Road Transport Authority (Dry Freight Transport certificate).
- Minimum of 5 owned trucks in the name of bidder trade name, installed with GPS.
- Bid Security Bond in the form of CPO (200,000 ETB) in the name of FH Ethiopia.
- Vehicle Insurance Certificate.

## Conditions and Information
- Bidders are advised to read the tender dossier carefully.
- Further information can be obtained from the Procurement unit during working hours before the closing date.
- A company stamp should be brought when collecting the tender dossier document.
- Additional instructions and information on submission are provided in the tender dossier.
- FH Ethiopia reserves the right to accept or reject the Framework Agreement partially or fully.

## Contact Information
- **Address:** FH Ethiopia, Megenagna Area around 40/60 Condominium, In front Of Ministry Of Revenue, Adjacent to Kideste Mariom Primary School, P. O. Box 4181, Addis Ababa, Ethiopia.
- **Telephone:** +251-11 616 6913

Key requirements include expertise in developing mechanisms, policies, and procedures related to Islamic finance. Bids must be submitted by 08 May 2025 at 16:00 UTC.
generated.clean_description:
# Request for Expressions of Interest (REOI)

## General Information

- **Country:** Ethiopia
- **Program:** Rural Financial Intermediation Program III (RUFIP-III)
- **Assignment:** Consultancy Service for the Development of Wholesale Islamic Financing Mechanisms
- **Selection Method:** Quality and Cost-Based Selection (QCBS)
- **IFAD Grant No.:** 2000003210
- **Reference No.:** IFAD/RUFIPIII/DBE/NCB/CS/02/2024/25

## Project Context

The Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia has received financing from the International Fund for Agricultural Development (IFAD) for RUFIP-III, with a portion of the funding allocated to qualified payments on assignments for consultancy services. The Development Bank of Ethiopia (DBE), one of the state-owned financial institutions engaged in providing project finance and lease financing for small and medium enterprises (SMEs), is utilizing part of this funding.

## Objectives

The DBE seeks expressions of interest from legally formed consulting firms to provide consultancy services aimed at developing wholesale Islamic financing mechanisms. The objectives include:

- **Developing Mechanisms, Policies, and Procedures:** To secure Sharia-compliant funds from global partners using licensed resource mobilization instruments and innovative Sharia-compliant products.
- **Establishing a Framework for External Fund and Credit Management Directorate (EFCD):** To provide Sharia-compliant wholesale financing to partner financial institutions in collaboration with the DBE's Interest-Free Banking Directorate, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements.
- **Advising on Accounting Records and Transaction Management:** For DBE's Interest-Free Banking operations, including integration with the bank's overall financial system.
- **Developing an Operational Manual:** For DBE wholesale interest-free financing intended for participating financial institutions.

## Terms of Reference

Interested consultants are encouraged to review the terms of reference for additional details on these consultancy services.

## Important Considerations

- **IFAD's Anti-Money Laundering and Countering Terrorist Financing Policy**
- **Revised IFAD Policy on Preventing Fraud and Corruption in its Activities and Operations:** This includes restrictions on prohibited practices.
- **IFAD Policy on Preventing and Responding to Sexual Harassment, Sexual Exploitation, and Abuse (SEA):** Ensuring a safe working environment free of harassment and sexual exploitation.

## Eligibility

Interested consultants must ensure they do not have any actual, potential, or reasonably perceived conflict of interest. Consultants with such conflicts will be disqualified unless explicitly approved by the Fund.

The attention of interested consultants is drawn to these policies and guidelines to ensure compliance throughout the process.

## Advertisement for Construction Companies

### Overview
The American Jewish Joint Distribution Committee (AJJDC), an International NGO registered with CSO and engaged in development activities in education, health, and water development sectors, is pleased to invite qualified and registered construction companies in Addis Ababa to submit their Technical & Financial proposals for the renovation work of AJJDC's office located at Olompia street in front of Getu Commercial Center, Bahir Building 5th floor.

### Requirements
- **TIN, VAT, and Business Registration:** Provide documents that are renewed and valid.
- **Company Profile:** Include a brief description of the company, relevant works, qualifications, and references from previous projects.
- **Cost Breakdown:** Provide detailed cost breakdown for the work including material costs, labor costs, and other related costs as per the Bill of Quantities (BoQ).
- **Timeline:** Submit a timeline for project completion.
- **Proposal Submission:**
  - One original and one copy document each of both financial & technical proposals.
  - A Certificate of Payment Obligation (CPO) for 2% of the total amount.

### Application Procedure
Interested companies who meet the above criteria can:
- Collect the Bid documents (BoQ and Drawing).
- Visit the office space.

**Deadline for Document Collection and Office Visit:** Thursday, April 17, 2025, until 10:30 Local Time.
**Bid Submission Deadline:** Thursday, April 24, 2025, until 10:30 Local Time.

### Notes
- **Note 1:** If any additions or omissions are found in the BoQ based on design and site visit, contact AJJDC only within the document collection dates (until April 17, 2025). Variations after this date will not be accepted unless there is a change made during construction.
- **Note 2:** The organization (AJJDC) has full rights to fully or partially cancel the bid.

### Location
Olompia street, in front of Getu Commercial Center, Bahir Building 5th floor.

### Contact Information
Email: JDCEthiopia@jdc.org

# Tender Opportunity for Implementing Improved Resilience and Market Access for Women in Trade in Ethiopia

## Overview of TradeMark Africa (TMA)
- Established in 2010, TMA is a leading African Aid-for-Trade organization focused on growing intra-African trade.
- Aims to increase Africa's share in global trade while making trade more pro-poor and environmentally sustainable.
- Focus areas include reducing the cost and time of trading across borders through enhanced trade policy, better infrastructure, standards that work for businesses, digital innovations, and creating trade access for vulnerable groups.

## Recent Rebranding
- TMA recently rebranded from TradeMark East Africa (TMEA) to serve partners in driving continental-wide trade gains.
- Expanding operations from the East and Horn of Africa to Southern and West Africa.

## Funding and Operations
- Operates on a not-for-profit basis, funded by institutional and philanthropic development partners.
- Works closely with regional and continental intergovernmental organizations, national governments, the private sector, and civil society organizations.

## Tender Opportunity Details

### Title: Implementing Improved Resilience and Market Access for Women in Trade in Ethiopia
- **Reference Number:** PRQ20241341

### Title: Design and Implementation of The Ethiopia Export Development Program
- **Reference Number:** PRQ20241342

## Tender Document Availability
- Can be obtained at [https://www.trademarkafrica.com/procurement/](https://www.trademarkafrica.com/procurement/)

## Submission Instructions
- All queries should be emailed to procurement@trademarkafrica.com, quoting the respective tender title and number.
- TMA cannot answer any query relating to this tender 7 days or less prior to the submission deadline.

Interested, qualified, and eligible bidders should submit bids in line with the bidding instructions provided in the tender document.

## Expression of Interest for Supply of Various Input Materials

### Overview
Awash Wine S.C., Ethiopia's leading and most historic winery, is committed to maintaining excellence in production, innovation, and quality by sourcing the best raw materials, packaging supplies, and industrial chemicals. To ensure a sustainable and reliable supply chain, we are expanding our supplier base and inviting potential suppliers to express their interest in partnering with us.

### Required Items

#### 1. Farm Chemicals and Fertilizers
- **Active Ingredients**
  - Hydrogen peroxide 50%
  - Spiroxamine 500 SC
  - Impulse 500 EC
  - Copper hydroxide 77% WP
  - Blue-gold 77 WP

#### 2. Cleaning and Sanitizing Chemicals

#### 3. Packaging and Labeling Materials
- Bottle Labels

#### 4. Other Industrial Chemicals

### Submission Requirements
Interested suppliers may submit their expression of interest along with the following documents to Bid@awashwine.com:

For further inquiries, please contact Bid@awashwine.com.

- The source of funds is World Bank (Bank) toward the cost of the 3R 4CACE *PROJECT.
- Payment for each lot will be requested separately by the bidder.

---

#### 3. Project Details
- **Lot 1:** Construction of fourteen (14) shallow wells (SW) water supply scheme in Mao-Komo special wereda, Shoshor Butiji and Wanga Giten kebele under Benishangul Gumuz Region.
- **Lot 2:** Construction of seven (7) shallow wells (SW) water supply scheme in Mao-Komo special wereda at Tsotsora kebele under Benishangul Gumuz Region.
- **Lot 3:** Installation of pipelines (2.5 inch HDP 600 m, 2 inch HDP 1500 m, 1.5 inch 1000 m, 1 inch 500 m) and fittings (union, valve, stafa etc.) in Mao-Komo special wereda; development of two spring water sources in Tongo kebele.

---

#### 4. Submission of Bid Documents
- Bids must be submitted in a sealed envelope to the tender box located at the Ministry of Water, Addis Ababa.
- Interested bidders can purchase complete bidding documents in English from the Benishangul Gumuz Region Mao-Komo Special Woreda Finance Office or the Ministry of Water and Energy compound in Addis Ababa for 11 calendar days from the last advertisement date on the Ethiopian Herald newspaper.

---

#### 5. Purchase Fee
- Non-refundable fee: Ethiopian Birr 2000.00 (Two Thousand Birr Only)
- Method of payment: Cash

---

#### 6. Bid Submission and Evaluation
- Original and copies of technical and financial proposals, as well as bid security in separate wax-sealed envelopes must be submitted to Benishangul Gumuz Region Mao-Komo Special Woreda Finance Office on or before 2:30 PM.
- Bids shall be opened at 3:00 PM at the Ministry of Water and Energy compound hall, Addis Ababa.
- Both technical and financial documents will be opened and announced within 6 days at the Benishangul Gumuz Region Water and Energy Resource Development Bureau meeting hall. Technical document evaluation is responsive before opening the financial document.

---

#### 7. Validity
- Bidding will be conducted in accordance with the Public Procurement Proclamation of the Government of the Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia.
- Bids shall be valid for a period of sixty (60) days, and bid security shall remain valid for 60 days after bid opening.

---

generated.clean_description:
# Request for Expressions of Interest

## Job Title: Consultancy Service for Source of Budget
### Reference No.: OSTA 01-2017

---

## General Objective
The overall objective of this consultancy is to strengthen OSTA's capacity to mobilize resources and develop strategic partnerships. This includes delivering a comprehensive framework that empowers OSTA to identify, secure, and manage diverse funding streams effectively.

## Specific Objectives
- Conduct a comprehensive assessment of OSTA's current resource mobilization, partnership efforts, and funding strategies.
- Identify gaps, opportunities, and potential risks in existing resource mobilization approaches.

---

## Eligibility Criteria
A bidder must provide the following documents to amend its evidence of continued eligibility:
- Valid business license indicating the stream of business in which consultancy is engaged.
- VAT registration certificate issued by the tax authority.
- Valid tax clearance certificate issued by the tax authority for the budget year.
- Audited financial statement by an independent auditor for the last one (1) year.
- Certificate of satisfactory execution of contracts.
- Written power of attorney of the signatory of the bid to commit the bidder.
- Signed and stamped Anti-bribery pledge form.

Short-listed consultancy firms will be invited to submit their technical and financial proposals via Request for Proposal (RFP).

---

## Work Experience
- **Resource Mobilization Experience:** Proven experience in resource mobilization, including securing funding, grants, or partnerships for projects.
- **International Relations & Development Partners:** Previous experience working with international organizations, development partners (e.g., UN, World Bank, NGOs), and managing cross-border collaborations.
- **Multi-Stakeholder Engagement:** Strong, demonstrated experience in engaging diverse stakeholders (government, private sector, communities, etc.), facilitating dialogue, and building consensus.

---

## Submission Details
Expressions of interest must be delivered in person on:
- 15/8/2017 E.C. (Eastern Calendar) at 10:00 PM/local time/in the afternoon.

Interested consultancy firms may obtain further information and Terms of Reference (TOR) for the consultancy assignment from Monday to Friday during office working hours:
- Morning: 2:30 AM - 6:30 PM/local time/in the morning
- Afternoon: 7:30 PM - 11:00 PM/local time/in the afternoon.

## Address of Documents Issued From, Inspected At, and Bids Delivered At:
Oromia Science and Technology Authority  
Street: Around Pushkin Square, the way to Kera  
Room Number: Building 2 Ground, Procurement Department  
Telephone: +251 951065267

---

For further inquiries, contact the Oromia Science and Technology Authority at the provided address.

# Repost Invitation for Bid (IFB)
## Procurement Reference Number: NCB/GW/013/2025

**Invitation to all eligible Water Well Drilling Contractors (WWDC) of grade 3 and above:** Provide a proposal for the drilling of one water well in Southern Ethiopia Regional State, South Omo Zone, Benatsemay Wereda, for community water supply purposes.

## Bidding Process
- **Bidding Method:** Open National Competitive Bidding (NCB), as per procedures specified in the tender document and pertinent procurement directive and guidelines.
- **Budget Secured:** Give Water has secured budget from donors to cover eligible payments under the contract Bid-No. NCB/GW/013/2025 for the procurement of drilling and construction of 1 water well for community water supply project.

## Eligibility Requirements
Interested bidders must submit documentary evidence demonstrating eligibility, which includes:
- VAT registration certificate
- TIN certificate
- Renewed business license and commercial registration certificate
- Renewed appropriate water works registration certificate from Construction authority or Regional water bureaus

## Document Availability
- **Document Fee:** Non-refundable fee of 100 ETB (one hundred birr only)
- **Availability:** Complete set of bidding documents can be obtained from Give Water head office, Finance Division during working hours starting from the publication date of this bid advertisement in a newspaper.
- **Contact Information:**
  - Tel: +251-912727484 / 0911552345
  - Email: givewater1@yahoo.com

## Further Clarification and Information
Interested eligible bidders may obtain further information or clarification from:
- Give Water head office, Finance Division at any working hour.
- Contact details: Tel: +251-912727484 / 0911552345; Email: givewater1@yahoo.com
- **Deadline for Clarification:** April 24th, 2025

## Bid Submission Requirements
- **Bid Validity Period:** Bids will be valid for sixty (60) days after bid opening.
- **Bid Security:** 
  - A bid bond (bid security) amounting to 1% of the total bid amount, including VAT, in CPO or unconditional bank guarantee must be submitted.
  - The security shall remain valid for twenty-eight (28) days beyond the end of the validity period of the bid.

## Submission Details
- **Bid Documents:** One original and one copy of technical and financial proposals and CPO, separately sealed in different envelopes clearly marked as "Technical/Financial" and "Original/Copy." All sealed envelopes should also be sealed in a larger envelope.
- **Deadline for Submission:** Deliver to Give Water by 2:00 PM (afternoon) on April 25th, 2025. Late bids will not be accepted.

## Bid Opening
- **Technical Bids:** Will be opened at the same time as bid submission deadline (April 25, 2025) at 3:30 PM in Give Water office.
- **Electronic Bidding:** Not permitted.

## Contact Information for Give Water
- Address: Addis Ababa, K/Keranyo sub-city, Tor-Hayiloch area, near down slope from Shoa Supermarket. On Emmu Tower, 2nd floor.
- Tel: +251-978668253
- Email: givewater10@yahoo.com

**Give Water**
Addis Ababa, Ethiopia

The Oromia Public Procurement and Property Disposal Agency has a mandate to procure common user items with a Frame Work Contract Agreement on behalf of Regional Public bodies who have funds within the public bodies' budget to be used for the Procurement of different types of Office Furniture (Re Bid).
The Oromia Public Procurement and Property Disposal Agency invites sealed bids from eligible bidders for the supply and delivery of: Different Types of Office Furniture.
The details of measurement & quantity of different types of Office Furniture are specified/listed in bid document.

Bid Security amount is One Percent (1%) of the offered total bid Price in ETB (Ethiopian Birr). NB: If the total bid security exceeds birr five hundred thousand (ETB 500,000.00), the bidder shall reduce the amount to five hundred thousand birr (ETB 500,000.00).

Bidding will be conducted through National Competitive Bidding (NCB) procedures contained in the Public Procurement Proclamation of the Regional Government of Oromia and are open to all eligible bidders.

Interested eligible bidders may obtain further information from Oromia Public Procurement and Property Disposal Agency and inspect the bidding documents at the address given below from Monday to Friday from 08:30 a.m. to 12:30 a.m. in the morning and 01:30 p.m. to 04:30 p.m. in the afternoon.

A complete set of Bidding Documents in English may be purchased by interested bidders at the address below and upon payment of anon-refundable fee of Ethiopian Birr 400 (Four Hundred Birr).The method of payment will be Cash on site.

Bids must be delivered to the address below at or beforeMay 2, 2025 G.C. up to 02:00 p.m.in the afternoon. Each item must be accompanied by a bid security of show in the above. Late bids shall be rejected.Bids will be opened in the presence of the bidder's/representatives who choose to attend at the address below May 2, 2025 G.C. at 02:15 p.m. in the afternoon.
The OPPPDA reserves the right to reject any bid and to annul the bidding process and reject all bids at any time prior to contract award, without thereby incurring any liability to bidders.

original.title: The Ministry of Water and Energy now invites eligible consulting firms ("Consultants") to indicate their interest in providing the Services for Energy Source Demand and Consumption Assessment

organization.name: The Ministry of Water and Energy now

generated.summary: The Ministry of Water and Energy is seeking consulting firms to provide services for an Energy Source Demand and Consumption Assessment, covering sectors such as households, service sector, industries, agriculture, and transport at the national level. Key requirements include assessing current and forecast future energy demand and consumption to inform strategic interventions aimed at increasing supply, access, and energy efficiency. Bids must be submitted by 29 April 2025, 14:00 UTC.
generated.clean_description:
# Request for Expressions of Interest (Consulting Services - Firms' Selection)

## Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia
### Ministry of Water and Energy

#### Project Title: 
Energy Source Demand and Consumption Assessment Project  
Reference No.: QCBS-MOWE-ESDCS-002/2024 - Re-bid

---

## 1. Objectives of the Assignment
To assess the current and forecast future energy source demand and consumption in sectors (Transport, Industry, Household, Service, and Agriculture) that contribute to sustainable development goals. The assessment will provide evidence-based strategic interventions areas, showing sectoral consumption status and demand needs, which can be used to increase supply, access, and energy efficiency improvement options.

---

## 2. Scope of the Consultancy Services
- **Sectors Covered**: Households, Service Sector, Industries, Agriculture, and Transports at national level.
- **Duration**: The assessment is expected to be completed within one year.
- **Task Breakdown**:
  - **Task 1: Main Tasks/Activities of the Consultant**
  - **Task 2: Detailed Brief Activities and Expectations from the Consultant**

Further details on objectives and scope will be provided in the Terms of Reference (TOR) available through the Ministry's website.

---

## 3. Duration of Assignment and Contract
- **Total Duration**: 360 calendar days, with possible extension based on performance.
- **Independent Verification**: Conducted as per the request of the grantee, with an estimated input of 12 man-months.
- **Evaluation Criteria for Full Technical Proposal**:
  - Core business and years in business
  - Qualification & relevant experience of the firm in the field of assignment (specific experience)
  - Organizational, managerial, and technical capabilities of the firm

Interested firms are reminded to refer to Section III, paragraphs 3.14, 3.16, and 3.17 of the World Bank's "Procurement Regulations for IPF Borrowers" July 2016 ("Procurement Regulations") for the policy on conflict of interest.

---

## 4. Selection Method
Consultants will be selected in accordance with the QCSB method set out in the Procurement Regulation (PPA).

Further information can be obtained from:
- Ministry of Water and Energy Website: <https://www.mowe.gov.et/en/resourcetypes/procurement-files>
- Office Hours: 9:00 AM to 12:00 PM, 2:00 PM to 4:30 PM (Monday to Friday)

---

## 5. Submission of Expressions of Interest
Expressions of interest must be submitted in writing by:
- In person
- By mail
- By e-mail

**Deadline**: April 29, 2025, 2:00 PM (Afternoon).

**Contact Information**:
- **Attn:** Mr. Mehandis Melaku, Executive Procurement Officer  
- **Address**: Haile Gebresilasie Avenue, 2nd Floor, Room Number 215  
- **Tel:** +251 11 689 8036  
- **E-mail:** procurement@mowe.gov.et

**Location**: Addis Ababa, Ethiopia

---

### Ministry of Water and Energy (MOWE)

• **Submission Deadline**: April 29, 2025, at 14:00 (Addis Ababa time).

• **Eligibility**: Open to eligible consulting firms.
• **Financial Information**: Bid security or equivalent guarantee is required. Specific details on fees and bid security amounts are not provided in the tender information.
• **Key Requirements**: The assessment should cover current energy source demand, consumption patterns, potential sources of energy, and recommendations for sustainable energy solutions.

- **Bid Opening Schedule:** May 1, 2025, 1:48:36 AM

---

### Eligibility Requirements

#### Financial Qualification
- **Historical Financial Performance:** Submission of audited balance sheets and other financial statements as required in the BDS Clause 15.2(b), for the last years to demonstrate the current soundness of the Bidder's financial position and its prospective long term profitability.
- **Average Annual Turnover:** The average annual turnover calculated as total certified payments received for contracts in progress or completed within the last years must exceed a certain multiple of the amount of the financial proposal of the Bid.

#### Financial Resources
- The Bidder must demonstrate access to, or availability of, financial resources such as liquid assets, unencumbered real assets, lines of credit, and other financial means, other than any contractual advance payments, to meet the following cash-flow requirement:

#### Legal Qualification
- **Valid Tax Clearance Certificate:** Domestic Bidders only must submit a valid tax clearance certificate issued by the tax authority in accordance with ITB Clause 4.6(b)(iii).
- **Debarment Status:** The Bidder must not have been debarred by decision of the Public Procurement and Property Authority from participating in public procurements for breach of its obligation under previous contracts in accordance with ITB Clause 4.4.

#### Form Data on Joint Ventures
- In the case of a bid submitted by a joint venture (JV), the Bidder has to submit:
  - The Form Data on Joint Ventures.
  - The Agreement governing the formation of joint venture, or letter of intent to form JV, including a draft agreement in accordance with ITB Clause 4.1.

#### VAT Registration Certificate
- Having been submitted VAT registration certificate issued by the tax authority (in case of contract value of Birr 100,000.00 and above) in accordance with ITB Clause 4.6(b)(ii).

#### Valid Business License
- Having been submitted valid trade license or business organization registration certificate issued by the country of establishment in accordance with ITB Clause 4.6 (b)(i).

#### Conflict of Interest
- No conflict of interest as described in ITB Sub-Clause 4.3.

#### Nationality
- Compliance with nationality requirements as specified in ITB Sub-Clause 4.2.

#### Professional Qualification
- **Professional Practice Certificates:** Bidder has to submit relevant professional practice certificates, if required in BDS Clause 15.2(b).

---

ማንኛውም ተጫራጭ የጨረታ ማስከበርያውን ኦርጂናል የጨረታ መክፈቻው ቀን ከመድረሱ አንድ ቀን ቀደም በሎ ደባርቅ ዩኒቨርስቲ ወይም አዲስ አበባ ጉርድ ሾላ ቶፕ ቴን ሆቴል ጀርባ የውሃ ልማት ፈንድ ቢሮ አጠገብ ከሚገኘው ማስተባበርያ ፅ/ቤታቸን ድረስ በአካል በመቅረብ ማስረከብ አለበት ሆኖም ግን ማቅረብ ካልቻለ ከውድድር ውጭ ይደረጋል።
በኢንተርፕራይዝ የተደራጁ ማህበራት /ድርጅቶች የተደራጁበትን ሙሉ ማስረጃ ኮፒ ማቅረብ ይጠበቅባቸዋል።
ዩኒቨርስቲው የተሻለ አማራጭ ካገኘ ጨረታውን ሙሉ በሙሉ ወይም በከፊል የመሰረዝ መብቱ የተጠበቀ ነው።
ማንኛውም ተጫራጭ ግልፅ እና ተነባቢ የሆኑ ኦርጂናል ሰነዶቹን ማያያዝ የሚጠበቅበት ሲሆን የቀረበው ማስረጃ የማይነበብ ወይም ግልጽ ካልሆነ ከውድድር ያሰርዛል።
ማንኛውም ተጫራች ጨረታው በተዘጋ በ30፡00 ደቂቃ ውስጥ የጨረታ መክፈቻ ሚስጥር ቁጥር (key share) ከሲስተሙ ላይ ማስቀመጥ ወይም መሙላት አለበት፤ ካላስቀመጠ ከውድድር ውጭ ያስደርጋል።
ማንኛውም ተጫራጭ የታክስ ክሪላንስ ማረጋገጫ ሰነድ ማቅረብ የሚኖርበት ሲሆን የታክስ ክሪላንስ የማያስፈልገው ከሆነ እንደማያስፈልገው ከሚመለከተው መ/ቤት ማቅረብ አለበት፤ ካላቀረበ ከውድድር ውጭ ያስደርጋል።
አሸናፊው ድርጅት ዩኒቨርሲቲው በመግባት ሙሉውን ስራ በመስራት ገጥሞ ማስረከብ አለበት።

# Invitation for Bids

## Project Information
- **Project ID:** MOA/PACT_G-NCBP02/25

### Objectives and Scope
- **PDO:** Empower 150,000 rural households to achieve sustainable income, food and nutrition security, and resilience.
- **Geographical Coverage:** Nine regional states: Amhara, Oromia, Southern Ethiopia, Central Ethiopia, South West Ethiopia, Sidama, Afar, Tigray, and Somali.
- **Duration:** Seven years, concluding in 2030.

## Procurement Details

### Goods to be Provided
- **Total Station:** 15 units
- **Hand GPS:** 90 units
- **Levelling Instruments:** 22 units

### Delivery
- **Delivery Location:** Ministry of Agriculture's head office.
- **Timeline:** Within 60 calendar days from the bid submission date.

## Bidding Process

### Eligibility and Participation
- Open to all eligible bidders.
- Bidders may associate with other entities to enhance their capacity for successful procurement.

### Evaluation Method
- **Method:** National Competitive Bidding (NCB).
- **Evaluation Procedure:** Described in IFAD Procurement Handbook available at [www.ifad.org/project-procurement](http://www.ifad.org/project-procurement).

### Pre-Bid Conference
- No pre-bid conference will be held.

## Bid Submission

### Document Purchase
- **Fee:** Non-refundable fee of 1,000 Birr.
- **Payment Details:**
  - Account Number: 1000009144009
  - Bank: Commercial Bank of Ethiopia (CBE)
  
- **Purchase Method:** Send an email or letter with full contact details to the following point of contact:
  - **Name:** Abduselam Ali, Senior Programme Procurement for PACT.
  - **Address:** Ministry of Agriculture, Gurdsholla, Next to Century Mall.
  - **Email:** Selitude@gmail.com

### Bid Submission
- **Deadline:** 16 May 2025, 10:00 AM EAT.

## Additional Information
- More details on the goods and related services are provided in the schedule of requirements within this bidding document.

  - **Criteria:**
    - Average Annual Turnover:
      - The average annual turnover calculated as total certified payments received for contracts in progress or completed within the last five years must exceed one-third (1/3) of the amount of the financial proposal.

generated.clean_description:
# Invitation to Tender: Kebri Dhar Airfield Reconstruction, Access Road and Parking Area Rehabilitation Project

## Bid Announcement No. SSNT-T533

### Overview
Ethiopian Airlines Group invites qualified Category 1 General and Road Contractors (GC/RC-1) for the Design-Build of the Kebri Dhar Airfield Reconstruction, Access Road, and Parking Area Rehabilitation Project.

### Eligibility Criteria
- Bidders must be legally established in Ethiopia with a renewed Trade License for the current year.
- Valid Tax clearance, VAT registration certificate, Taxpayer Identification Certificate (TIN), and Tax clearance certificate are required to demonstrate eligibility to participate in any public tender. These documents must remain valid at least until the deadline for submission of bids.
- Bidders must have a Renewed certificate of registration from an authorized body in category GC/RC-1 and be registered as a Supplier in the list of the mandated public body, i.e., Public Procurement and Property Administration Agency (PPPAA).
- Bidders currently engaged in two or more projects with Ethiopian Airlines Group, where the completion percentage of each project is less than 70%, are not permitted to participate.

### Deposit
A non-refundable deposit of ETB 100.00 must be deposited to the nearby Commercial Bank of Ethiopia (CBE) and referred to this tender number SSNT-T533, Ethiopian Airlines Group Account Number 1000006958277 (E-99). The bidder should email a scanned copy of the deposit slip to the following address to receive the Tender document.

### Bid Security
Bidders must furnish bid security in the form of:
- A Certified Performance Obligation (CPO) or an unconditional and irrevocable bank guarantee with an amount of ETB 500,000.00.
- Insurance guarantees will not be accepted.

### Validity of Bids
Bids shall remain valid for a period of One Hundred Fifty (150) Calendar Days after the tender opening.

### Submission and Opening of Bids
- **Sealed Bid Proposals**: Must be submitted in separate envelopes, namely:
  - Technical Proposal
  - Financial Offer
  - Bid Security
- Each envelope should be marked as "ORIGINAL" or "COPIES."
- The outer envelope must clearly indicate the contents.
- Deliveries must be made to Ethiopian Airlines Group, Strategic Sourcing Non-Technical office by **May 14, 2025, at 11:00 AM**.
- Bids will be opened on the same date at 11:30 AM at Ethiopian Airlines Group Head Office in Addis Ababa.

### Contact Information
For further information, please contact:
- **Ethiopian Airlines Group**
  - Bole International Airport, Addis Ababa, Ethiopia
  - Tel. +251-11-517-4028
  - E-mail: AynalemAy@ethiopianairlines.com

### Disclaimer
Ethiopian Airlines Group reserves the right to cancel or modify the tender partially or entirely.

---

This document is intended to provide a clear and structured overview of the tender requirements. Please ensure all details are accurately followed.

- Valid Business License (E.C. 2017 Renewed)
- Taxpayer Registration Certificate (TIN)
- VAT Registration Certificate

- Company Profile listing the bidders’ address, branches, structure, resources, etc.
- Evidence of past satisfactory performance on the provision of similar supplies.

---

## Tender Submission Requirements:
- **Technical Envelope:**
  - Must be sealed and bear an official company seal
  - Clearly marked with bidder’s name, address, tender reference number, and title

- **Financial Envelope:**
  - Must be sealed and bear an official company seal
  - Clearly marked with bidder’s name, address, tender reference number, and title

- Tenders must be submitted in the bid box prepared for these purposes at SOS Children’s Village Ethiopia National office in Addis Ababa.

---

## Items to Be Procured:
### Sewing Tools
1. **Sewing Machine Juk**
   - Quantity: 11 pcs
2. **Overlock**
   - Quantity: 6 pcs
3. **Embroidery Praise**
   - Quantity: 6 pcs
4. **Iron Philips**
   - Quantity: 6 pcs
5. **Interlock**
   - Quantity: 6 pcs

### General Maintenance and Workshop Tools
1. **Open Wrench Finder 6.32**
   - Quantity: 6 pcs
2. **PPR Cawoya Total 1500W-2 INCH**
   - Quantity: 6 pcs

---

## Evaluation Criteria:
The tender evaluation will not be based solely on the total price but rather on procuring each item at the lowest cost available, as bidders may not necessarily have all the listed items. Therefore, please provide a quote only for the items currently available in stock.

---

## Additional Information:
- SOS Children’s Villages in Ethiopia reserves the right to accept or reject this bid, in partial or in its entirety.
- The tender document must be submitted in a sealed envelope and marked by the “bidders’ name, address, and the tender reference number and title as stated above.”

---

generated.summary: The Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia, Ministry of Finance is inviting bids for the procurement of 575 Cooking Demonstration Kits comprising various kitchen utensils and equipment such as cooking pots, chopping boards, knives, bowls, spoons, cups, plates, ladles, and washing bowls. Bidders are required to submit their sealed quotations by April 25, 2025, at 05:00 AM (Ethiopia time).
generated.clean_description:
# Request for Bids and Quotation

## Project Information
- **Country:** Ethiopia
- **Name of Project:** Human Capital Operation Project
- **Contract Title:** Procurement of Cooking Demonstration Kits (QTY 575 Kits) for 23 Woredas for UNISE Implementation
- **Grant No.:** IDA-E2060
- **RFQ Reference No.:** ET-MOF-480687-GO-RFQ

## Scope of Supply
The Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia, Ministry of Finance has received financing from the World Bank toward the cost of the Human Capital Operation Project and intends to apply part of the proceeds toward payments under the contract for the supply of Cooking Demonstration Kits for 575 health facilities across 23 Woredas for UNISE Implementation. The required items are as follows:

- **Cooking Pot:** Stainless steel, Medium (4,000ml), Quantity: 1,725
- **Chopping Board:** Plastic, Medium (30cm x 45cm), Quantity: 1,725
- **Knife:** Stainless steel, Medium (30cm), Quantity: 1,725
- **Small Bowl:** Mica, Small (500ml), Quantity: 3,450
- **Tablespoon:** Stainless steel, 10ml, Quantity: 3,450
- **Teaspoon:** Stainless steel, 5ml, Quantity: 2,300
- **Cup:** Plastic, Small (200ml), Quantity: 5,750
- **Steer:** Wooden, Medium, Quantity: 1,725
- **Plate:** Mica, Medium, Quantity: 11,500
- **Ladle:** Stainless steel, Medium (100 Liter), Quantity: 1,725
- **Washing Bowl:** Plastic, Medium (10 Liter), Quantity: 1,725
- **Washing Jug:** Plastic, 1,000 ml, Quantity: 575
- **Kerosene or Wood:** Medium, Quantity: 115
- **Plastic Bucket:** Plastic, 20 liters, Quantity: 575
- **Sponge for Washing:** Sponge, Large, Quantity: 2,300
- **Ajacs Soap:** Soap, Large, Quantity: 11,500
- **Toilet Soap:** Soap, Large, Quantity: 11,500
- **Hand washing Bowl:** Plastic, Medium, Quantity: 1,725

## Bidding Process
The competition will be conducted through a national bid using a Request for Quotations as specified in the World Bank's "Procurement Regulations for IPF Borrowers" September 2023 ("Procurement Regulations"), and is open to all eligible bidders as defined in the Procurement Regulations.

### Information and Document Availability
- **Further Information:** Interested eligible bidders may obtain further information from:
  - Ministry of Finance, Channel One Programs Coordinating Department (COPCD)
  - Address: Sidist Killo, Yekatit 12 Square, King George Avenue, in front of Lion Cage, Main Building, 6th floor, Room No. 615
- **Office Hours:** 2:30 PM to 5:00 PM local time

### Purchase of Bidding Documents
- **Documents Available:** The bidding document in English may be purchased by interested eligible quotation providers upon the submission of a written application and payment of a non-refundable fee of ETB 100.
- **Method of Payment:** Cash

## Submission of Quotations
- **Deadline for Submission:** Bids must be delivered to the address below on or before April 25, 2025. Electronic quotations will not be permitted.
- **Bid Security:** All quotations must be accompanied by a "Bid Security" of ETB 70,000.00 in the form of Bank Guarantees.

## Public Opening of Bids
The quotation will be publicly opened in the presence of bidders' designated representatives and anyone who chooses to attend at the address below on April 25, 2025.

### Address for Submission and Opening:
- **Channel One Programs Coordinating Department (COPCD)**
  - Sidist Killo, Yekatit 12 Square, King George Avenue
  - In front of Lion Cage, Main Building, 6th floor, Room No. 615
  - Tel: +251-11 120 4000 (Extension 1605/1636/1617)

## Contact Information
For further inquiries, please contact:
- **Ministry of Finance**
  - Sidist Killo, Yekatit 12 Square, King George Avenue
  - In front of Lion Cage, Main Building, 6th floor, Room No. 615
  - Tel: +251-11 120 4000 (Extension 1605/1636/1617)

---

This document outlines the requirements and procedures for submitting bids for the procurement of Cooking Demonstration Kits as part of the Human Capital Operation Project in Ethiopia.

#### Eligibility Requirements:

##### Financial Qualification:
- **Factor:** Financial Resources
  - The Bidder must demonstrate access to, or availability of, financial resources such as liquid assets, unencumbered real assets, lines of credit, and other financial means, other than any contractual advance payments.
- **Criteria:**
  - Submission of audited balance sheets and other financial statements as required in the BDS Clause 17 for the last three years to demonstrate the current soundness of the Bidder's financial position and its prospective long-term profitability.
  - Average Annual Turnover:
    - The average annual turnover calculated as total certified payments received for contracts in progress or completed within the last three years must exceed one-third (1/3) of the amount of the financial proposal.

##### Legal Qualification:
- **Factor:** Form Data on Joint Ventures
  - In the case of a bid submitted by a joint venture (JV), the Bidder has to submit the Form Data on Joint Ventures, the Agreement governing the formation of the joint venture, or letter of intent to form JV, including a draft agreement.
- **Criteria:**
  - Valid tax clearance certificate (Domestic Bidders Only) in accordance with ITB Clause 4.6
  - VAT registration certificate (in case of contract value of Birr 200,000.00 and above) in accordance with ITB Clause 4.6

##### Conflict of Interest:
- **No conflict of interest as described in ITB Clause 6**

##### Nationality:
- **Nationality in accordance with ITB Clause 4.2**

##### Valid Trade License or Business Organization Registration Certificate:
- **Having been submitted valid trade license or business organization registration certificate issued by the country of establishment in accordance with ITB Clause 4.6**

##### Debarred by Decision of the FPPA:
- **Not having been debarred by decision of the Public Procurement Agency from participating in public procurements for breach of its obligation under previous contracts in accordance with ITB Clause 4.3**

##### Government Owned Entity:
- **Compliance with conditions of ITB Clause 4.4**

#### Professional Qualification:
- **Factor:** Number of Staff
  - At least [specific number] staff currently work for the Bidder.
- **Criteria:**
  - Personnel for key positions among the staff mentioned in Sub-Clause 2.

Please ensure all eligibility documents are submitted by the bid submission deadline.

# Invitation for Bids: Drilling and Construction of Shallow Wells

## Project Overview
- **Project Type:** Drilling and Construction of 18 Shallow Wells
- **Bid Reference Number:** ETMOF-BULDIGLU-478441-CW-RFQ
- **Source of Funds:** 3R PROJECT

## Eligibility Criteria
- Contractors must be in category WC, Class Five and above with a renewed license valid for the 2017 E.C. year.
- Must hold:
  - Water well drilling license level-5 and above
  - Renewed trade license
  - VAT registration certificate
  - Certificate of competence
  - Trade license registration
  - Supplier registration certificate

## Project Details
- **Lot 1:** Construction of eleven (11) Shallow Wells (SW) water supply scheme at Jenferere, Atseleho, and Bulpili kebeles under Benishangul Gumuz Region in Assosa Zone in Buldiglu woreda.
- **Lot 2:** Construction of seven (7) Shallow Wells (SW) water supply scheme at Faduni and Qedo kebeles under Benishangul Gumuz Region in Assosa Zone in Buldiglu woreda.

## Bidding Process
- **Bidding Documents:** Complete set available from the Ethiopian Herald newspaper advertisement in the Benishangul Gumuz region water, and energy resource development Bureau, Assosa. Available for 11th calendar days from the last advertisement date.
- **Fee for Documents:** Non-refundable fee of Ethiopian Birr 2000.00 (Two Thousand Birr Only).
- **Method of Payment:** Cash.

## Submission Requirements
- Original and copies of technical and financial proposals, as well as bid security in separate wax-sealed envelopes.
- Address: Benishangul Gumuz region Buldiglu woreda finance office 3R-4CACE Project.
- Deadline for submission: On or before 2:30 PM on the 11th calendar day from the last advertisement date notice on the Ethiopian Herald.

## Bid Opening
- **Date and Time:** 3:00 PM, same day as bid submission deadline.
- Location: Benishangul Gumuz Region water and Energy Bureau meeting hall in Assosa.
- Both technical and financial documents will be opened and announced within 6 days at the bureau. After evaluation of the technical document, the financial document will also be opened.

## Validity
- Bids are valid for a period of sixty (60) days.
- Bid security is valid for 60 days after bid opening.

## Additional Information
Bidding will be conducted in accordance with the Public Procurement Proclamation of the Government of the Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia and is open to all eligible bidders.

generated.clean_description:
# National Competitive Bidding (NCB) for New 400KVA Soundproof, Diesel-Driven Generator

## Contract Title
Supply, Installation, Test, Commissioning of New 400KVA Soundproof, Diesel-Driven Generator with ATS & Configuration with Existing Power System at MoWE Compound.

## Reference Number
MOW E-NCB-G-GOV-04-2017

### Procurement Details
The Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia intends to allocate funds for the procurement of a 400KVA soundproof, diesel-driven generator. The Ministry of Water and Energy (MoWE) invites sealed bids from eligible bidders.

## Bidding Requirements

### Eligibility Criteria
- **Contract Experience**: Bidder must have successfully completed at least two contracts with a budget of at least ETB 10,000,000.00 each in the past five years.
- **Financial Stability**: Audited financial statements for the last five years confirming a minimum peak annual turnover of ETB 150,000,000.

## Bidding Process
- **Procedure**: National Competitive Bidding procedures as specified in the Federal Public Procurement Directive 2010.
- **Eligibility**: Open to all eligible bidders.

## Documentation Requirements
- Copy of renewed trade licenses.
- VAT certificate.
- Tax clearance TIN certificate.
- Registration in FPPA supplier list for local bidders (if applicable).

## Information and Document Availability
- Further information can be obtained from the Ministry of Water and Energy during office hours 8:30 AM to 5:30 PM local time at:
  - Address: Haile Gebresilassie Avenue, 2nd floor Room No.211, Addis Ababa, Ethiopia.
  - Attention: Mr. Mehandis Melaku
- Full bid documents can be obtained from the Ministry's website or in person during working hours.

## Bid Submission and Security
- **Bid Security**: Unconditional Bank Guarantee or CPO for ETB 200,000.00 (Two hundred thousand Birr).
- **Validity Period**: 128 days.
- **Deadline for Submission**: May 15, 2025 at 2:00 PM.
- **Opening of Bids**: May 15, 2025 at 2:30 PM in the presence of bidders' representatives.

## Bid Validity
- Bids will remain valid for a period of 90 days after the bid submission deadline.

## Contact Information
- Ministry of Water and Energy
- Address: Haile Gebresilassie Avenue, 2nd floor Room No.211, Addis Ababa, Ethiopia.
- P.O.Box: 13/1076
- Telephone: +251 11 689 8036
- Email: Procurement@mowe.gov.et

## Important Notes
The Ministry of Water and Energy reserves the right to reject all or part of the bid.

original.title: The United Nations Economic Commission for Africa (UNECA) in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, hereby seeks expressions of interest (EOI) from qualified and experienced vendors for the Procurement of Emergency Medicines for Pharmaceutical Items LTA

requirements: Must be legally registered and licensed to operate as a pharmaceutical wholesaler, or community pharmacy.
Must possess all necessary licenses, permits, and registrations required by the relevant national drug regulatory authority.
Must ensure that all supplied medicines & Medical supplies are legally imported or manufactured, with all required documentation (e.g., import licenses, certificates of origin)

The vendor must maintain high standards of quality control and assurance throughout their supply chain. Medicines must meet all relevant quality standards and specifications set by the local regulatory authority.
Must have a proven track record of supplying high-quality, authentic, and safe medications. Capacity and Reliability:
The vendor must demonstrate the capacity to consistently supply the required medicines in the quantities and timeframe specified by the UNHCC.
Must demonstrate a reliable and consistent supply chain to ensure uninterrupted availability of medications.
Must maintain adequate stock levels to meet the UNHCC's anticipated demand.
The vendor should provide information on their stock levels and supply chain capabilities.
Companies can only participate in solicitations of the UN Secretariat after completing their registration (free of charge) at the United Nations Global Marketplace (www.ungm.org).

As you express interest in the planned solicitation by submitting this response form, please verify that your company is registered under its full legal name on the United Nations Global Marketplace(www.ungm.org) and that your application has been submitted to the UN Secretariat.

While companies can participate in solicitations after completion of registration at Basic Level, we strongly recommend all companies to register at least at Level 1 under the United Nations Secretariat prior to participating in any solicitations.

Companies are reminded of the restrictions of employment of former UN personnel that were involved in the procurement process during their last three years of service as per ST/SGB/2006/15, including (a) employing those personnel for one year after separation of service and (b) allowing those personnel to communicate with, or appear before, active UN personnel for matters related to the procurement process for two years after separation of service. Violation of the provisions of ST/SGB/2006/15 may lead to suspension of the registration of the company as a UN vendor.

specifications.Note: Information on tendering for the UN Procurement System is available free of charge at the following address:https://www.ungm.org/Public/NoticeOnly the United Nations Global Marketplace (UNGM) has been authorised to collect a nominal fee from vendors that wish to receive automatically Procurement Notices or Requests for Expression Of Interest. Vendors interested in this Tender Alert Service are invited to subscribe onhttp://www.ungm.org
