generated.clean_description:
# United Nations Economic Commission for Africa (UNECA) Expression of Interest (EOI)

## Overview

- **Title of EOI:** Procurement of Emergency Medicines for Pharmaceutical Items LTA
- **Date of this EOI:** 10 April 2025
- **Closing Date for Receipt of EOI:** 25 April 2025
- **EOI Number:** EOIUNECA23570
- **Beneficiary Country/Territory:** Ethiopia
- **Commodity/Service Category:** Health Services

## Contact Information

- **Attention Of:** Ms. Etsegenet Teka / Mr. Ali Assaad / Ms. Aster Zewde
- **Fax Number:** N/A
- **E-mail Address:** etsegenet.argaw@un.org

## Description of Requirements

The United Nations Economic Commission for Africa (UNECA) in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, seeks expressions of interest from qualified and experienced vendors for the procurement of emergency medicines for pharmaceutical items LTA.

### Objectives
- To minimize stockouts and ensure the steady availability of essential medicines.
- To enhance the responsiveness of the pharmacy unit to the needs of healthcare providers.
- To improve overall healthcare delivery and patient satisfaction among staff.

## Legal and Regulatory Compliance

- **Legal Registration:** Must be legally registered and licensed as a pharmaceutical wholesaler or community pharmacy.
- **Licenses and Permits:** Must possess all necessary licenses, permits, and registrations required by the relevant national drug regulatory authority.
- **Import Documentation:** All supplied medicines and medical supplies must be legally imported or manufactured with all required documentation (e.g., import licenses, certificates of origin) provided upon request.

## Quality Assurance

- **Quality Control Standards:** The vendor must maintain high standards of quality control and assurance throughout their supply chain. Medicines must meet all relevant quality standards and specifications set by the local regulatory authority.
- **Track Record:** Must have a proven track record of supplying high-quality, authentic, and safe medications.

## Capacity and Reliability

- **Supply Capabilities:** The vendor must demonstrate the capacity to consistently supply the required medicines in the quantities and timeframe specified by the UNHCC.
- **Reliable Supply Chain:** Must demonstrate a reliable and consistent supply chain to ensure uninterrupted availability of medications.
- **Stock Levels:** Maintain adequate stock levels to meet the UNHCC's anticipated demand. Provide information on current stock levels and supply chain capabilities.

## Submission Instructions

Interested firms will be invited to tender by an "Invitation To Bid" (ITB) at a later stage. Please submit your expression of interest via fax or e-mail before 25 April 2025.
- **Fax Number:** N/A
- **E-mail Address:** etsegenet.argaw@un.org

For further inquiries, contact the United Nations Economic Commission for Africa using the provided email address.

---

**UNSPSC Codes:**
- 51000000 - Drugs and Pharmaceutical Products
- 51440000 - Radiopharmaceuticals and contrast media
- 51441600 - Diagnostic agents and radiopharmaceuticals

- Register in person at Head Office, 10th floor, procurement department upon fulfilling trade license certificate and TIN (Taxpayer Registration Certificate)

- The bid shall be valid for 45 days after the system bid closing date.

### Bid Security
- Submit bid security in person at head office of the enterprise, 10th floor procurement department.
- Amount: 100,000 (One Hundred Thousand) birr
- Types of acceptable bid security:
  - Unconditional bank guarantee
  - Cash payment order (CPO)
- Bid security validity: 28 days beyond the end of the validity period of the bid proposal. Total valid period: 45 + 28 = 73 days

### Unit Price Submission
- Submit unit price at lines level form in the Oracle System without 15% VAT.

- ESL may prepare a pre-bid conference for all bidders after the floating of the bid by the newspaper.

- On ERP System

#### Procurement of Medical Equipment Accessories

- **Bid Submission Deadline:** April 27, 2025, 10:34:05 PM
- **Bid Opening Schedule:** April 27, 2025, 11:04:05 PM

---

### Eligibility Requirements

#### Financial Qualification
**Factor:** Criteria  
- **Historical Financial Performance:** Submission of audited balance sheets and other financial statements as required in the BDS Clause 15.2(b), for the last years to demonstrate the current soundness of the Bidder's financial position and its prospective long-term profitability.
- **Average Annual Turnover:** The average annual turnover calculated as total certified payments received for contracts in progress or completed within the last years must exceed a certain multiple of the amount of the financial proposal of the Bid.

**Financial Resources:**
The Bidder must demonstrate access to, or availability of, financial resources such as liquid assets, unencumbered real assets, lines of credit, and other financial means, other than any contractual advance payments, to meet the following cash-flow requirement.

---

#### Legal Qualification
**Factor:** Criteria  
- **Valid Tax Clearance Certificate:** Having been submitted a valid tax clearance certificate issued by the tax authority (Domestic Bidders Only) in accordance with ITB Clause 4.6(b)(iii).
- **Debarred by Public Procurement and Property Authority:** Not having been debarred by decision of the Public Procurement Agency from participating in public procurements for breach of its obligation under previous contracts in accordance with ITB Clause 4.4.

---

#### Form Data on Joint Ventures
In the case of a bid submitted by a joint venture (JV), the Bidder has to submit:
- **Form Data on Joint Ventures**
- The Agreement governing the formation of joint venture, or letter of intent to form JV, including a draft agreement in accordance with ITB Clause 4.1.
- **VAT Registration Certificate:** Having been submitted a VAT registration certificate issued by the tax authority (in case of contract value of Birr 100,000.00 and above) in accordance with ITB Clause 4.6(b)(ii).
- **Valid Business License:** Having been submitted a valid trade license or business organization registration certificate issued by the country of establishment in accordance with ITB Clause 4.6 (b)(i).

---

#### Conflict of Interest
No conflict of interest as described in ITB Sub-Clause 4.3.

---

#### Nationality
Nationality in accordance with ITB Sub-Clause 4.2.

---

#### Professional Qualification
**Factor:** Criteria  
- **Professional Practice Certificates:** Bidder has to submit relevant professional practice certificates, if required in BDS Clause 15.2.

This structured format preserves all important details while ensuring clarity and readability.

generated.summary: The United Nation Economic Commission for Africa (UNECA) is seeking an Expression of Interest to procure a WhatsUp Gold Network Availability and Performance Monitoring Tool, providing complete visibility into the status and performance of applications, network devices, and servers in both cloud and on-premises environments. Bids must be submitted by 21 April 2025.
generated.clean_description:
# Request for Expression of Interest (EOI)

## General Information

- **Title of the EOI:** Request for Procurement of WhatsUp Gold Network Availability and Performance Monitoring Tool
- **Date of this EOI:** 11 April 2025
- **Closing Date for Receipt of EOI:** 21 April 2025
- **EOI Number:** EOIUNECA23573

## Contact Information

- **Email Address:** welela.berihu@un.org; assaad@un.org
- **Attention to Fax Response:** Mrs. Welela Berihu / Mr. Ali Assaad
- **Fax Number:** N/A

## UNSPSC Code
- 43233000 - Operating environment software

## Description of Requirements

The United Nations Economic Commission for Africa (UNECA) is seeking an Expression of Interest (EOI) to procure a WhatsUp Gold Network Availability and Performance Monitoring Tool. This tool should provide complete visibility into the status and performance of applications, network devices, and servers in both cloud and on-premises environments.

### Key Requirements
- **Functionality and Simplicity:** The tool must offer comprehensive features with an easy-to-use interface.
- **Perpetual License Options:** Bidders must be able to provide perpetual license options for 500 new devices.
- **Authorized Reseller Status:** The bidding firm must be an authorized reseller with after-sales support.

## Registration and Eligibility

- **UNGM Registration:** UNECA is precluded from entering into a contract with firms not fully registered with the United Nations Global Marketplace (UNGM). Interested vendors are encouraged to register before submission of their bid.
  - Further details can be obtained by visiting: [https://www.ungm.org/Vendor/Registration](https://www.ungm.org/Vendor/Registration)
- **Eligibility Criteria:** Vendors must declare in writing the Prerequisite for Eligibility criteria (A-F) as contained in the EOI instructions attached.
  - Only eligible firms that pass this pre-qualification stage will be invited to participate further.

## Submission Instructions

- **Expression of Interest Submission:** Interested vendors should submit their "Expression of Interest" by the deadline of 21 April 2025. Write to the above-mentioned email address: welela.berihu@un.org; assaad@un.org
- **Vendor Response Form:** Vendors interested in participating should complete and submit the Vendor Response Form available at:
  - [https://www.ungm.org/Public/Notice/264118](https://www.ungm.org/Public/Notice/264118)
- **UNGM Registration:** The successful bidder will be required to register in UNGM before contract award.

## Notes

Interested vendors should ensure they meet all the eligibility criteria and submit their responses by the specified deadline.

## Overview
- **Tender Number:** NVI/INT/02/2025

    - Tel.: +251-11 433 8339
    - Mobile: +251 90 307 8888
    - Fax: +251-11 433 9300

## Re-advertisement for Open Bid: Procurement and Installation of Solar Water Pump in Melkadida

### Project Overview
- **Project Name:** Protect-24 “Control and Utilization of P.juliflora Integrated with Livelihood Improvement and Environmental Protection in Liban Zone (Dollo-Ado & Bokolmayo Districts)”
- **Funding Source:** Spanish Cooperation

### Tender Details

#### 1. Invitation to Bid
Save the Environment Ethiopia (SEE), a non-profit, non-religious, and non-political local NGO operating in the Somali Regional State of Ethiopia, is inviting eligible companies for the supply, transport, and installation of solar water pumps.

#### 2. Scope of Work
- **Supply:** Solar water pump systems.
- **Transport:** To Dolo Ado and Bokolmayo districts.
- **Installation:** At Melkadida refugee camps.

#### 3. Bid Information
- **Further Information:** Interested bidders may obtain the bid document and application form from SEE offices in Addis Ababa, Jigjiga, or Melkadida.
- **Bid Submission:** Bidders must submit their bid documents with a copy in wax-sealed envelopes to:
  - Save the Environment Ethiopia office in Jigjiga
  - Save the Environment Ethiopia office in Addis Ababa (Gurd Shola area, Daminarof building next to Century Mall, 5th Floor, office #503)
  - Melkadida suboffice

#### 4. Bid Closing and Opening Dates
- **Bid Closing Date:** 10 days from the date of this advertisement.
- **Bid Opening Date:** One day after the closing date, at Save the Environment Ethiopia offices in the presence of bidders or their legal representatives.

#### 5. Terms and Conditions
- **Eligibility Requirements:**
  - Renewed 2017EC trade license
  - TIN number
  - Registered with VAT
  - Legal capacity to enter into a contract

- **Contract Agreement:** A successful bidder will enter into a contract agreement with SEE upon receiving an authorized purchase requisition.

#### 6. Dispute Resolution
Any disputes from non-performance or non-compliance with the terms and conditions set forth in the dual agreement between the supplier and Save the Environment Ethiopia shall be submitted to the Somali Regional State Higher Court, whose decision will be final.

#### 7. Specifications
- **Solar Water Pump Specifications:** Refer to the bid document.
- **Country of Production:** Specify the country of production in the bid document.

#### 8. Delivery and Installation Dates
- **Delivery Date:** Indicate the delivery date for the entire set.
- **Installation Date:** Indicate the installation date.
- **Project Completion Date:** Indicate the project completion date.

### Contact Information
- **Save the Environment Ethiopia, Addis Ababa office:**
  - Address: Gurd Shola area, Daminarof building next to Century Mall, 5th Floor, office #503
  - P.O. Box: 620
  - Mobile: +251 911-012645, +251 960-089575

- **Save the Environment Ethiopia, Jigjiga office:**
  - Mobile: +251 912-120750

- **Melkadida suboffice:**
  - Mobile: +251 915-551533

- **Email:** see@saveenvironment.org
- **Website:** www.saveenvironment.org

### Bid Document Details
- **Bid Document Title:** Protect 24 Project 11 Kilowatt Solar Water Pumping BOQ for 25 Hectare-Farm (4 sets, each 25 ha.)

---

generated.summary: The Ministry of Water and Energy is seeking bids for the procurement of drilling, construction, and pumping tests of three deep production wells in Kumbi Wereda, East Hararge Zone. Bidders must submit sealed proposals by 15 May 2025 at 10:00 AM.
generated.clean_description:
### Invitation for Bid (IFB) ET-MOWE-465456-CW-RFB

**Ministry of Water and Energy**
**Country:** The Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia  
**Name of Project:** Climate Resilient -Water Supply and Sanitation Project  
**Contract Title:** Procurement of Drilling, Construction and Pumping Test of Three Deep Production Wells for Kumbi Wereda Multi Village Water Supply Project in East Hararge Zone (at Jiddo Well Field)  
**Loan/Credit No.:** IDA 64450

---

#### 1. Overview
- **Project Description:** The Government of the Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia has received financing from the World Bank toward the implementation of water supply, sanitation and hygiene projects.
- **Procurement Method:** Part of the proceeds will be applied to payments under the contract for the procurement of drilling, construction, and pumping test of three deep production wells for Kumbi Wereda Multi Village Water Supply Project in East Hararge Zone (at Jiddo Well Field).
- **Disbursement Method:** Direct Payment disbursement method as defined in the World Bank's Disbursement Guidelines for Investment Project Financing, except for those payments made through a letter of credit.

#### 2. Invitation to Bid
The Ministry of Water and Energy invites sealed bids from eligible bidders for the procurement of works described below.
- **Procurement Reference Number:** ET-MOWE-465456-CW-RFB
- **Description of Works:** Drilling, construction, and pumping test of three deep production wells at Kumbi Wereda Multi Village Water Supply Project in East Hararge Zone (at Jiddo Well Field).

#### 3. Qualification Requirements

**a. Financial Capability:**
- The Bidder must demonstrate access to or availability of liquid assets, unencumbered real assets, lines of credit, and other financial means sufficient to meet the construction cash flow requirements estimated at ETB 23 million for the subject contract(s) net of any other commitments.
- The Bidders should also show adequate sources of finance to meet the cash flow requirements on works currently in progress and for future contract commitments.
- Audited balance sheets or, if not required by the laws of the Bidder's country, other financial statements acceptable to the Employer must be submitted for the last five years (2020 to 2024) to demonstrate the current soundness of the Bidder’s financial position and indicate its prospective long-term profitability.

**b. Peak Annual Construction Turnover:**
- The peak annual construction turnover should be 75 million or above, calculated as total certified payments received for contracts in progress and/or completed within the last five years (2020 to 2024).

**c. Experience:**
- **General Construction Experience:** At least five years of experience under construction contracts in the role of prime contractor, joint venture member, subcontractor, or management contractor starting January 2020 G.C.

---

*Note:* The Bidder is encouraged to read and respond to the exhaustive list of post-qualification requirements specified in section III. Financial Situation and Performance of the Request for Bids (RFB).

    - Bidder must submit certified financial statements by an independent auditor, as required in ITB Clause 15.2(a) for the period specified in Section 3, Evaluation Methodology and Criteria.
  - **Average Annual Turnover:**
    - The average annual turnover for the period specified in Section 3, Evaluation Methodology and Criteria does not exceed the amount of the financial proposal of the Bid in value as specified in the BDS.

- **Legal Qualification**
  - **Bidder Nationality:** In accordance with ITB Sub-Clause 4.2.
  - **Conflict of Interest:** No conflict of interest as described in ITB Clause 4.3.
  - **VAT Registration Certificate for Domestic Bidders:**
    - Having been submitted VAT registration certificate issued by the tax authority (in case of contract value of Birr 100,000.00 and above) in accordance with ITB Clause 4.6(b)(ii).
  - **Valid Tax Clearance Certificate for Domestic Bidders:** 
    - Having been submitted valid tax clearance certificate issued by the tax authority (Domestic Bidders Only) in accordance with ITB Clause 4.6(b)(iii).
  - **Valid Business License:**
    - Having been submitted valid trade license or business organization registration certificate issued by the country of establishment in accordance with ITB Clause 4.6(b)(i).

- **Debarred by a decision of the Public Procurement and Property Authority:** 
  - Bidder has not been debarred by a decision of the Public Procurement and Property Administration Agency from participating in public procurements for breach of its obligation under previous contracts, in accordance with ITB Clause 4.4.

- **Form Data on Joint Ventures:**
  - In the case of a bid submitted by a joint venture (JV), the Bidder has failed to submit the Form Data on Joint Ventures, the Agreement governing the formation of joint venture, or letter of intent to form JV, including a draft agreement, in accordance with ITB Clause 4.1.

- **Personnel for Key Positions:**
  - Among the staff mentioned in Sub-Clause 2.1 Bidder must demonstrate that it will have the personnel for the key positions that meet the following requirements:
    - At least [specific number] of staff currently work for the Bidder.

---

- No pre-bid conference or site visit schedule is applicable.
- Clarification requests and bid submissions are subject to the specified deadlines.

## Request for Quotation (RFQ) No: DUP2-06-2025

### Issuance Date and Important Deadlines
- **Issuance Date:** April 13, 2025
- **Questions Due Date/Time:** April 16, 2025, 5:00 pm Local time/Addis Ababa
- **Question Answered & Shared Date:** April 17, 2025
- **Quotation Due Date/Time:** April 19, 2025, 5:00 pm Local time/Addis Ababa

### Project Overview
JSI Research & Training Institute, Inc. is a US-based public health non-profit organization dedicated to improving people's lives through greater health, education, and socioeconomic equity. With over 45 years of experience, JSI supports governments, health professionals, civil society, and community leaders in more than 40 countries.

The Ethiopia Data Use Partnership (DUP) Work Stream 1 is a collaborative project between JSI Research and Training Institute and the Ethiopian Ministry of Health, funded by the Gates Foundation. The project aims to advance healthcare through the Information Revolution agenda, focusing on fostering an information culture, digitizing priority health information systems, and enhancing HIS governance.

### Procurement Details
- **Number of Tablets:** 24 (Twenty-Four)
- **Purpose:** Project engagement in implementation of Alliance for Gender Awareness and Resourcefulness (AGAR)

### Eligibility Criteria
Interested potential suppliers must:
- Be locally registered companies.
- Have a valid trade license.
- Specialize in the field relevant to this procurement.

Suppliers should send an email requesting the bid document prepared for the purpose fee change before April 15, 2025, 5:00 pm Local time/Addis Ababa, to:
- **Email:** elizabeth_yoseph@et.jsi.com

### Required Documents
Bidders are required to submit the following documents enclosed with their quotation:

- Quotation with detailed specification for each option as per the given requirements.
- Warranty period and conditions (minimum one-year).
- Copy of Valid Trade License.
- Copy of Tax Identification Number (TIN) certificate.
- Copy of Value Added Tax (VAT) certificate.
- Tax Clearance certificate for the current year.
- Fixed delivery date (should be specified).

### Submission Instructions
- **Closing Date for Submission:** April 19, 2025, 5:00 pm Local time/Addis Ababa.
- **Submission Method:** Drop off the proposal in the appropriate box designed for this purpose at the main entrance of the project office located at Sengatera Tarde Union Share Company building, 5th floor, Lideta Sub City, Woreda 09, House Number 235.

### Project Reserves
The project reserves all rights to cancel the RFQ fully or partially any time before, during, or after the bid evaluation process.

---

## Overview
UNICEF Ethiopia is inviting eligible local bidders to participate in the Invitation to Bid (LITB-2025-9196504) for the long-term procurement of toolkits and spare parts for hospital biomedical workshops.

- **Bid Document Link:** [https://tender.2merkato.com/tenders/67efd2edcb9ae0fa8e08f3e2](https://tender.2merkato.com/tenders/67efd2edcb9ae0fa8e08f3e2)

generated.summary: The Hailemariam & Roman Foundation is procuring consultancy services to undertake an Agrarian Analysis Study (AAS) for the Preservation of Maze National Park and its Watershed in Ethiopia. The study aims to assess local community livelihood strategies and their impact on the park. Bids must be submitted by 29 April 2025.
generated.clean_description:
# Expressions of Interest for Agrarian Analysis Study (AAS) in Maze National Park

## Project Overview
- **Project Title:** The Preservation of Maze National Park and its Watershed in Ethiopia
- **Funding Source:** Agence Française de Développement (AFD)
- **Implementing Organization:** Hailemariam & Roman Foundation (HRF)

## Project Context
- **Park Location:** Maze National Park, South Ethiopia
- **Project Duration:** 2024-2028
- **Overall Goal:** Ensure the long-term integrity of Maze National Park for nature and communities

## Objectives of Agrarian Analysis Study (AAS)
- Assess current livelihood strategies and activities of local communities surrounding the park.
- Evaluate their impact on biodiversity.
- Suggest alternative, sustainable livelihood options that balance community economic needs with conservation goals.

### Specific Focus Areas
- **Socio-economic and demographic profiles** of the communities.
- Documentation of existing agricultural and off-farm activities.
- Recommendations for agriculture-related livelihood strategies to reduce pressure on park resources.

## Scope of Services
- **Geographical Coverage:** Five woredas (Zala, Daramalo, Kucha, Kucha Alpha, and Kamba) and 17 park-adjacent kebeles.
- **Data Collection Methods:**
  - Designing data collection tools.
  - Conducting surveys, key informant interviews, focus group discussions, and field observations.
- **Report Development:** Comprehensive report including recommendations for sustainable livelihoods and strategies to mitigate the impact of agricultural activities on the park.
- **Stakeholder Engagement:** Collaborating with local government offices, park staff, and HRF Program team.

## Expected Deliverables
- Inception report.
- Draft AAS report.
- Final AAS report with a brief policy brief.
- Clean datasets for future monitoring and evaluation.
- Duration: Approximately 2-3 months.

## Important Dates and Requirements
- **Start Date:** To be determined upon contract signing.
- **End Date:** To be determined based on the agreed duration of approximately 2-3 months.
- **Expert Months Involved:** Multiple expert months for fieldwork, data analysis, and report preparation.

## Additional Information
- The study will align with the already agreed Environmental and Social Management Framework (ESMF) and the Environmental and Social Management Plan (ESMP) of the Maze Project.

---

This structured format ensures clarity and ease of understanding while preserving all critical details from the original document.

generated.clean_description:
# Request for Expression of Interest (EOI)

## General Information

- **Title of the EOI:** Request for Procurement of WhatsUp Gold Network Availability and Performance Monitoring Tool
- **Date of this EOI:** 11 April 2025
- **Closing Date for Receipt of EOI:** 21 April 2025
- **EOI Number:** EOIUNECA23573

## Contact Information

- **Email Address:** assaad@un.org
- **Attention to Fax Response:** Mrs. Welela Berihu / Mr. Ali Assaad (Fax number not provided)

## Description of Requirements

The United Nations Economic Commission for Africa (UNECA) is seeking an Expression of Interest (EOI) to procure a WhatsUp Gold Network Availability and Performance Monitoring Tool that provides complete visibility into the status and performance of applications, network devices, and servers in both cloud and on-premises environments.

- **Required Specifications:**
  - Functionality and simplicity
  - Comprehensive features with an easy-to-use interface (UI)
  - Perpetual license options for 500 new devices

## Eligibility Requirements

- The bidding firm must be an authorized reseller with after-sales support.
- Interested firms must be fully registered with UNGM to be eligible for contract consideration. Those not currently registered are encouraged to register before submitting the bid.

### Registration Details
- **Registration Link:** [https://www.ungm.org/Vendor/Registration](https://www.ungm.org/Vendor/Registration)
- **Eligibility Criteria:**
  - Write to the provided email address to submit your "Expression of Interest" by the deadline of 21 April 2025.
  - Complete and submit a fully completed Vendor Response Form via the link provided:

  - Submission of audited balance sheets and other financial statements as required in the BDS Clause 15.2(b), for the last years to demonstrate the current soundness of the Bidder's financial position and its prospective long-term profitability.

  - The average annual turnover calculated as total certified payments received for contracts in progress or completed within the last years must exceed a certain multiple of the amount of the financial proposal of the Bid.

##### Legal Qualification
- **Nationality**
  - Nationality in accordance with ITB Sub-Clause 4.2.

- **Debarment Status**
  - Not having been debarred by decision of the Public Procurement and Property Authority.
  - Not having been debarred by a decision of the Public Procurement Agency from participating in public procurements for breach of its obligation under previous contracts in accordance with ITB Clause 4.4.

##### Form Data on Joint Ventures

  - The Form Data on Joint Ventures.
  - Agreement governing the formation of joint venture, or letter of intent to form JV, including a draft agreement in accordance with ITB Clause 4.1.
- **VAT Registration Certificate**
  - Submission of VAT registration certificate issued by the tax authority (in case of contract value of Birr 100,000.00 and above) in accordance with ITB Clause 4.6(b)(ii).
- **Valid Business License**
  - Submission of valid trade license or business organization registration certificate issued by the country of establishment in accordance with ITB Clause 4.6 (b)(i).

##### Conflict of Interest
- No conflict of interest as described in ITB Sub-Clause 4.3.

##### Professional Qualification

- At least [insert required number] staff currently work for the Bidder.

#### Bidder Certification of Compliance Form
- Bidder has to provide in the Bidder Certification of Compliance Form information related to its professional qualification and capability for the period specified in the BDS Clause 14.

- **Factor:** Submission of Certificates of Satisfactory Execution of Contracts

# Request for Expressions of Interest (REOI)
## Consulting Services - Firms Selection

### Project Details
- **Name of Country:** Ethiopia
- **Name of Project:** Ethiopian Emergency Locust Response Project (EELRP)
- **Credit No.:** IDA-67980
- **Assignment Title:** Assessment of Livelihood Support and Pesticide Inventory Storage Standards (Post-Distribution Assessment of Agricultural Inputs and Assessment of Pesticides Store Standards in Ethiopia)
- **Reference No.:** ET-MOA-477148-CS-QCBS

### Objectives of the Assignment
The Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia has received financing from International Development Association (IDA) and other development partners toward the cost of the Ethiopian Emergency Locust Response Project (EELRP). The project intends to apply part of the proceeds for consulting services.

#### General Objective
- Conduct a post-harvest assessment of agriculture input distribution interventions under the livelihood component.
- Produce a report with findings on the distribution process, results, lessons learned, success stories, and recommendations to inform ongoing project implementation.

#### Specific Objectives
1. Assess the performance of the project's input distribution intervention in achieving its objectives under the livelihood component.
2. Evaluate the variety, quantity, quality, and timeline of inputs distributed to meet beneficiaries' needs.
3. Ensure intended recipients are receiving support as per the project design.
4. Assess the process of providing livelihood interventions to affected households, including transparency and community involvement in household selection and determining the level of livelihood support required.
5. Evaluate how much assistance effectively addresses the extent of damage caused by locust infestations.
6. Determine if accountability mechanisms were in place at the community, woreda (district), and project levels.
7. Assess documentation of input distribution lists and other livelihood-related documentation at woreda and regional levels across the project.
8. Evaluate how effectively the project has engaged with key stakeholders and beneficiaries.
9. Measure beneficiary satisfaction on the intervention.
10. Examine the project's results and their contributions to livelihood rehabilitation.
11. Provide lessons learned, success stories, and actionable recommendations to inform project implementation.

### Eligibility Criteria
The Food Security Coordination Office (FSCO) of the Ministry of Agriculture (MoA) invites eligible consulting firms ("Consultants") to indicate their interest in providing these services. Interested consultants should provide information demonstrating that they have the required qualifications and relevant experience to perform the Services, including:
- Brochures
- Description of similar assignments
- Experience in similar conditions
- Availability of appropriate skills among staff

### Short-Listing Criteria
The short-listing criteria include:
- Core business and years in business
- Relevant experience
- Technical and managerial capability of the firm

For more details, please refer to Section III, paragraphs 3.14, 3.16, and 3.

Interested consultants are encouraged to submit their expressions of interest by [insert submission deadline here].

# Request for Expressions of Interest (Consulting Services - Firms Selection)
## Ethiopia Flood Management Project (E-FMP) Grant No. E124-Et

### Assignment Title:
Consultant Service for Environmental and Social Impact Assessment (ESIA) Study for Flood Protection Infrastructure Civil Works of Awash, Omo, and Rift Valley Lakes.

### Reference Number:
ET-MOWE-469062-CS-CQS

## General Information
The Government of Ethiopia has received financing from the World Bank toward the cost of the Ethiopia Flood Management Project (EFMP) and intends to apply part of the proceeds for consulting services. The consulting services ("the Services") include conducting an Environmental and Social Impact Assessment (ESIA) study for flood protection infrastructure civil works in Awash, Omo, and Rift Valley Lakes.

## General Objectives
The main objective of the consultancy service is to undertake an ESIA for the Awash, Omo, and Rift Valley Lakes Basin flood management project. This aims to identify environmental and social impacts and risks that may occur during construction and operation activities and develop a subsequent Environmental and Social Management Plan (ESMP) to address these impacts/risks and enhance positive benefits from ET-FMP activities.

## Specific Objectives
- Conduct ESIA and identify both beneficial and adverse impacts and/or risks from the EFMP intervention.
- Recommend measures to avoid, control, mitigate, restore, and/or compensate for project's anticipated environmental and social risks and impacts.
- Detail environmental and social requirements in the ESIA and its associated sub-reports and/or plan. This will guide the project's final design and components, including recommendations (design measures) for changes to the project design and specific actions to be taken by contractors and/or subcontractors.
- Prepare an ESIA report, including technical sub-reports and a detailed ESMP along with a monitoring program for the proposed project.

## Scope of Services
The consulting firm will carry out desktop reviews and field studies in the project woredas (districts) to fully describe the environmental and social baseline of the project areas. The firm is expected to undertake investigations on social aspects, economic activities, conservation of natural resources, historical and anthropological heritages, and conduct public consultations. Additionally, the firm will identify and describe impacts and associated mitigation measures for the design, construction, and operation phases.

## Person-Months & Duration
The consulting firm is required to input 9 person-months within a duration of 3 months from the end of June 2025.

### Detailed Terms of Reference (TOR)
Detailed Terms of Reference can be found at:
https://www.mowe.gov.et/en/resource_types/tor

## Shortlisting Criteria
- Firm's core business and years in business.
- Qualifications in the field of the assignment.
- Technical and managerial organization of the firm.

The attention of interested consultants is drawn to Section III, paragraphs 3.14, 3.16, and 3.

Interested consultants are invited to indicate their interest in providing these services by submitting information demonstrating that they have the required qualifications and relevant experience to perform the Services.

# Invitation for Bid (IFB)
## National Competitive Bid (NCB)

### Country:
The Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia

### Organization:
Agricultural Transformation Institute (ATI)

### IFB Title:
Supply and Delivery of Papaya Seedling (Red Lady Variety) - Grown by Pots and Ready for Transplanting) for Afar Region

### IFB Number:
ATA-NCB-G-2025-0031

## 1. Overview
The Ethiopian Agricultural Transformation Institute (ATI), an initiative of the Government of Ethiopia, was established by federal regulation following a two-year diagnostic study across eight sub-sectors of Ethiopia's agricultural system. The ATI is a result of a highly consultative, multi-stakeholder process led by the Ministry of Agriculture.

## 2. Funding
The Institute has funds from GOV-ACC for the supply and delivery of Papaya Seedling (Red Lady Variety) - grown by pots and ready for transplanting) for Afar Region.

## 3. Invitation to Bid
The Agricultural Transformation Institute now invites sealed bids from eligible and qualified bidders to participate in the supply and delivery of Papaya Seedlings as specified above. Bidding will be conducted in accordance with the open tendering procedures contained in the Public Procurement Proclamation of the Government of the Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia. Bidding is open to all bidders from eligible source countries.

## 4. Bid Submission
- **Bid Fee:** A non-refundable fee of Birr 200.00 (Two Hundred Birr) may be paid via Commercial Bank of Ethiopia A/C No. 1000517806424 (Original Deposit Slip required).
- **Deadline for Bid Submission:** Bids must be delivered to the address below at or before 2:00 P.M., April 28, 2025.
- **Electronic Bidding:** Not permitted. Late bids will be rejected.

## 5. Bid Opening
Bids will be opened in the presence of bidders' representatives who choose to attend in person at the address below at 2:30 P.M., April 28, 2025.

## 6. Bid Security
All bids must be accompanied by:
- **Bid Security:** ETB 32,000.00 (Thirty Two Thousand Birr) in the form of CPO or unconditional Bank Guarantee.

## 7. Documentation Requirements
The bidder should submit a copy of:
- Renewed Trade License
- VAT Registration Certificate

## 8. Purchaser's Rights

generated.clean_description:
# Request for Expression of Interest

## Country and Organization
- **Country:** The Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia
- **Organization:** Agricultural Transformation Institute (ATI)

## IFB Title and Number
- **IFB Title:** Hiring of IT Consultant for the Customization of African Adaptation Atlas System
- **IFB Number:** RE-ATA-NCB-CON-2025-0001

## Overview of ATI
The Ethiopian Agricultural Transformation Institute (ATI) is an initiative of the Government of Ethiopia established by federal regulation. Its mission is to promote agricultural sector transformation by supporting existing structures of government, the private sector, and other non-governmental partners to address systemic bottlenecks and deliver on a priority national agenda aimed at achieving growth and food security.

## IT Consultant Services
ATI seeks professional services from reputable consultants to submit an Expression of Interest (EOI) for customizing the African Adaptation Atlas System. The overall objective is to deploy and customize the existing application based on high-level user requirements, which will be gathered from stakeholders. Key tasks include:
- Reviewing and refining relevant documents
- Reviewing the existing technologies
- Customizing the web application

## Submission Requirements
Interested companies should submit an EOI that includes:
- Description of Core Business & years in business
- Relevant experience in the field of assignment
- Technical and managerial capabilities
- Profile of key personnel

Companies interested in participating can form associations as sub-consultants or joint ventures.

## Evaluation Process
Expressions of interest will be evaluated according to procedures specified in the public procurement directive.

## Submission Details
- **Deadline:** April 25, 2025, at 2:00 P.M.
- **Submission Method:** Hand-delivered to ATI tender box

## Contact Information
- **Address:** Ethiopian Agricultural Transformation Institute (ATI) Procurement Team Office, Bole, Off Meskel Flower Road, Adjacent to School of Commerce Students' Association Compound, 3rd Floor, Addis Ababa, Ethiopia
- **Phone:** +251-1-15-57-06-71 / Mr. Abdeta 09-48-06-18-08

## Important Notes
- Late submissions will be rejected.
- ATI reserves the right to cancel the procurement process at any time without incurring liability or obligations to inform affected applicants of the grounds for cancellation.

---

**Note:** For more information, interested parties can contact Abdeta Mohammed via email: abdeta.mohammed@ati.gov.et

# Invitation for Printing Suppliers' Framework Agreement Tender

## Tender Reference Number: ITT/IN-SCI-ET-2025-004

Save the Children International (SCI, Ethiopia), a leading independent non-profit organization for children worldwide, intends to enter into an agreement with printing suppliers for items listed below. This will be based on a framework agreement for a period of two years.

## Tender Documentation and Procurement Process

### Eligibility Documents
- Renewed Valid Business License
- Company Profile listing the bidder's address, branches, structure, resources, etc.

### Submission Instructions
- Tenders must be submitted via email to: ethiopia.bidsubm@savethechildren.org
  - Submit a compiled document clearly marked with:
    - Bidder’s name
    - Address
    - Tender reference number (ITT/IN-SCI-ET-2025-004)
    - Title of the tender

### Important Dates
- **Tender Document Availability:** April 13, 2025, to May 4, 2025
- **Submission Deadline:** May 4, 2025
- **Opening of Tender Responses:** May 5, 2025

### Official Bid Link
For the official bid link, please visit:
[https://ethiojobs.net/job/XD1JDVr5gq-invitation-to-tender](https://ethiojobs.net/job/XD1JDVr5gq-invitation-to-tender)

## Additional Information
SCI reserves the right to accept or reject this bid in part or in its entirety.
